loans.name: Wuanerges Amed

texts.es: Wuanerges es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una empresa cercana a su vivienda, lo cual le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Él tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeña hija de 4 años de edad. Wuanerges desea reconstruir la galera de la entrada de su vivienda, ya que la madera se encuentra deteriorada, al igual que las láminas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reconstruir la galera y evitar que la lluvia ingrese a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wuanerges is a hard-working man who lends his services to a business near his home, which has allowed him to raise his family. He is 35 years old and lives in a house that he owns along with his life companion and their little 4-year-old daughter.

Wuanerges wants to rebuild the veranda of the entrance of his home, since the wood is deteriorated, as well as the metal sheeting. For this reason, he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to rebuild the veranda and keep the rain from coming into his home.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized metal sheeting, wood, and nails to rebuild the veranda and keep the rain from coming into his home.

loans.name: Dúo Raquel De Santiago Group

texts.es: Dúo Raquel De Santiago, el dúo lo representa la señora Maria Claret, madre soltera de dos niños, uno de ellos estudia,  doña Claret se dedica a la venta de consumo diario como venta de golosinas, venta de granos como frijol, maíz, pastas, y también gaseosas, carne de pollo, y embutidos,  desde hace cinco años, ella trabajaba pero por la necesidad que vivía y por sus hijos y poder estar más tiempo con ellos, está feliz pues inicio con poco de capital y comenzó a vender ahora ya invierte mucho mas, es su segundo crédito su sueño es dejarle a sus hijos un futuro mejor que el que ella tubo. Esta solicitando este crédito para la compr de productos comestibles para vender.
texts.en: The Raquel De Santiago Dúo is represented by Maria Claret. She is a single mother of two children, one of whom studies. Claret has been working selling daily use products such as the sale of candies, grain sales like beans, corn, pasta and also soft drinks, chicken and sausages for five years. She works out of necessity given her situation, for her children and to be able to have more time with them. She is happy since she started selling with very little capital and now she has much more invested. This is her second loan. Her dream is to leave her children a better life than what she had. She is requesting this loan to buy food products to sell.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Elemie

texts.en:
Elemie is 43 years old and married with six children. She has four children in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

Elemie runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, etc. to sell. Elemie has been in this business for 20 years and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Elemie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, sugar, coffee, detergent soap, soft drinks, fabric conditioner, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 39-year-old married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school.

Leonora is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Leonora has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Leonora has worked in pig fattening for the past 7 years and she has borrowed 9 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Annie

texts.en:
Ma. Annie is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children, five of whom attend school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ma. Annie has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy sugar, coffee, and utensils for her cafeteria. She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Ma. Annie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, and utensils for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lourdes has requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. Lourdes has worked in pig fattening for the past 7 years she has borrowed 7 previous loans from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Brihaspati's Group

texts.en:
In the evening gloom of their dirt courtyard, Brihaspati (standing to the extreme right in the photograph) and her three daughters are growing desperate. They last answered nature's call 13 hours ago, but it's not yet dark enough to venture into the fields.

Brihaspati, a humble lady from Korba district of Chattisgarh, does not have access to basic sanitation facilities due to the unavailability of a toilet at her home. This compels her and her family to walk long distances in the dark in order to relieve herself in dense bushes late at night and early in the evening. She finds this practice very dangerous, as she feels the risk of insect and animal bites, and she is vulnerable to crimes.

In order to restore her privacy and maintain proper hygiene, Brihaspati, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to install a latrine pan and a hand pump, and build a toilet in her house.

Your loan will help Brihaspati to enjoy a healthy and disease-free life.

loans.use: to install a latrine pan and a hand pump, and build a toilet in her house.

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es: María es una mujer admirable que todos los días muestra sus deseos de superación, ya que desde hace 8 años se dedica a la costura y arreglo de prendas de vestir, dicha actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Ella vive junto a su esposo y su madre y su hermana, en casa de su propiedad. María desea construir una galera frente a su vivienda, ya que con las fuertes lluvias, el agua ingresa a su vivienda, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: polines, pines, lámina galvanizada y mano de obra para construir la galera de su vivienda.
texts.en:
María is an admirable woman who every day demonstrates her desire to excel. For eight years now she has worked sewing and fixing clothing. This activity has allowed her to get her family ahead. She lives together with her husband, her sister and her mother in a house that they own.

María wants to construct a veranda at the front of her house as water enters the house during heavy rains. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in beams, fasteners, galvanized laminate and labor to construct a veranda on her house.

loans.use: to invest in beams, fasteners, galvanized laminate and labor to construct a veranda on her house.

loans.name: Kheng

texts.en:
Kheng is a 36-year-old rice farmer from Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. She is a hard-working mother of three children who are enrolled in primary school. Her husband is a fisherman. Together they earn a net profit of approximately $6 USD per day.

Kheng and her family are currently facing some financial difficulties. She needs some money to buy fishing materials for her husband that she can’t afford. Therefore, she would like to get a Kiva loan to help them. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials.

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La señora Andrea tiene 54 años, ella es muy trabajadora gran parte de su vida se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida en el mercado, ella tiene 6 hijos y sale adelante gracias a su esfuerzo a diario para aportar gastos en su hogar.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papa, arroz, aceite y fideos, así poder ampliar su capital en su negocio de venta de comida.
la fotografía de la socia que esta añadida en la parte inferior es de la señora Antonieta , ella pidió permiso por motivo laboral y llego tarde.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de Internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de turismo y publicidad entre otros.
La socia está muy agradecida y contenta con el crédito ya que le ayudara mucho en su negocio.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Banco del Desarrollo." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 
Andrea is a 54-year-old woman, and she is very hardworking. She dedicates a big part of her life to her business of selling food in the market. She has 6 children, and she gets ahead thanks to her daily effort to provide for household expenses. Andrea is requesting the loan in order to purchase potatoes, rice, oil, and pasta, so that she can increase her capital in her food sale business.
The photograph of the member that is added to the bottom is Antonieta. She asked permission for work reasons and arrived late. The other members work in the laundry business, Internet business, a grocery store, tourism and advertising business, among others.
Andrea is very thankful and happy with the loan since it will help her a lot in her business.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, rice, oil, and pasta

loans.name: Dúo El Duraznal Group

texts.es: Dúo El Duraznal, este Dúo esta conformado por la señora Maria Victoria de 35 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de calzado para mujeres, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años,ya ha tenidos otros créditos en kiva, y a pagado puntual, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de calzado para mujeres para vender.
texts.en: The pair Dúo El Duraznal includes Maria Victoria, who is 35 years old. She works in the production and sale of women's shoes. She has worked in this occupation for several years. She has had other loans on Kiva and has paid on time. On this occasion, she is asking for this loan for the purchase of raw materials for the production of women's shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the production and sale of women's shoes.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Marisol, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia Marisol continua dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia sigue  elaborando diferentes tipos de platos apara sus  clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, menestras, arroz entre otros.
texts.en:
This [communal bank] member is Señora Marisol. She belongs to the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

Marisol continues selling food as a street vendor. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to be able to obtain more earnings with her work so that from this she can continue supporting her family. She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments as scheduled. She continues making different types of dishes for the customers who come to her, since this is the way she is raising her family.

She is applying for the loan to purchase oil, dried vegetables, and rice, among other items.

loans.use: to buy oil, dried vegetables, and rice, among other items.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Mercedes, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de comida en su restaurante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia sigue  elaborando diferentes tipos de platos apara sus  clientes que le solicitan.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, carnes, papas, menestras  entre otros.
texts.en:
This [communal bank] member is Señora Mercedes. She belongs to the "Señor de los Temblores II" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

She continues selling food in her restaurant. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to be able to obtain more earnings with her work and from this continue supporting her family. She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She feels grateful for the loan granted, and she promises to make the scheduled payments. She continues making different types of dishes for her customers who come to her.

She is applying for the loan to purchase oil, meats, potatoes, and dried vegetables, among other items.

loans.use: to buy oil, meats, potatoes, and dried vegetables, among other items.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Norma, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” ,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Norma  continúa con su negocio de imprenta,  la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cartuchos de colores  entre otros.
texts.en:
The member is Norma. She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco, and region of Cusco.
Norma continues with her printing business. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to obtain a larger income with her work, and in this way continue supporting her family. She has had the business for some time, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day, as this is the way that the member helps her family get ahead.
The member asks for the loan for the purchase of color cartridges, among others.

loans.use: to buy color cartridges, among others.

loans.name: Julia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Julia es propietaria de una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y  además elabora pupusas para vender, es casada, vive en compañía de su esposo y una hija de 18 años de edad, cuenta que su negocio está funcionando desde hace 15 años, inicia cada día sus labores a las seis de la mañana y las finaliza a las seis y media de la tarde, son actividades que aprendió de su familia, por el momento no presenta dificultades en su negocio.
Ella invertirá en productos como: arroz, aceite, bebidas, huevos, azúcar, etc., para surtir más el inventario de la tienda, tendrá más que ofrecer a sus clientes a precios justos, así tendrá oportunidad de incrementar ventas y ganancias.
El sueño por el que lucha constantemente es sacar a su familia adelante y darles una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Julia is the owner of a basic necessities store. In addition, she makes pupusas for sale. She is married and lives together with her husband and an 18-year-old daughter.

She says her business has been functioning for 15 years. She starts her work every day at 6 in the morning and finishes at 6:30 at night. She learned the work from her family. At the moment, she does not have any difficulties in her business.

She will invest in products such as: rice, oil, drinks, eggs, sugar, etc. to stock up her store's inventory more. She will have more to offer her clients at just prices, and thus will have an opportunity to boost her sales and profits.

Her dream, for which she fights constantly, is to get her family ahead and to give them a more decent life.

loans.use: to invest in products such as: rice, oil, drinks, eggs, sugar, etc. in order to stock up her store.

loans.name: Señor De Media Luna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal "SEÑOR DE MEDIA LUNA", este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

La socia Eusebia tiene 44 años, ella es una persona trabajadora y honrada, desde hace mucho tiempo ella se dedica a dos pequeños negocios que son: La venta de comida y la venta de pasto y alfalfa, con estas dos actividades saca adelante a sus 4 hijos.
Ella trabaja desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche, sus sueños es tener un local propio donde expender sus productos.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar papa, arroz, lentejas y carne.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurante, servicio de taxi, crianza de animales y negocio de construcción, entre otras actividades.
Los  socios  están muy contentos y agradecidos con los inversionistas de KIVA, por confiar en su  banco, se comprometen a cumplir puntualmente sus cuotas acordadas.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Señor de Media Luna." This bank is located in the province and department of Cusco.

Bank member Eusebia is 44 years old. She is a hard-working and honest person. She has been working in two little businesses for a long time: selling food and selling fodder and alfalfa. With these two businesses, she is raising her four children.

She works from very early until late at night. Her dreams are to have a shop where she can sell her products.

She is applying for the loan to buy potatoes, rice, lentils, and meat.

The other members work in the restaurant business, taxi service, raising animals, and a construction business, among other activities.

The members are very happy and grateful to the Kiva investors for having confidence in their bank. They promise to make their agreed-upon payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, rice, lentils, and meat.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Doña Lucia es una mujer muy esforzada, que se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos, actividad en la cual posee amplia experiencia. Solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000), para la compra de cerdos y alimentación para los mismos. Esto le permitirá mejorar el desarrollo de su actividad y de esta forma incrementar los ingresos familiares que provienen de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Doña Lucia is a very hard-working woman who raises and fattens pigs, a business in which she has broad experience.

She is applying for a loan of one million colones (₡ 1,000,000) for the purchase of pigs and food for them. This will allow her to improve the development of her business and in this way increase the family income that comes from this business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 64 years old, and she is married with 7 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosalia has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more items such as canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

Rosalia has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as canned goods, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Nora has a native bag making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Nora has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Rosa, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia sigue  dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas,la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Rosa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la compra de llantas.
texts.en:
The member is Rosa, she belongs to the communal bank “Señor de los Temblores II” in the city of Cusco, Perú.
She continues working to provide a taxi service. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, with her work, hopes to obtain a bigger income, and in this way continue supporting her family. She is grateful for the given loan, and she is committed to meeting the established payments. She has had her business for some time, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day, as it is in this way that she helps her family get ahead.
On this occasion, Rosa requires the loan for the purchase of tires.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a farming vegetables business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 12 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marianita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, requiere de otro préstamo para poder comprar maíz, aceite, quesillo, tomates, etc., para elaborar la venta de tortillas y pupusas, además adquirirá variedad de calzado y prendas de vestir para salir a vender de manera ambulante, su deseo es mantenerse trabajando y aprovechar los meses venideros que son buenos para comercializar su producto.
Ella está feliz por la buena experiencia que ha obtenido al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio, comenta que ha mejorado en gran manera su competitividad y la atención a los clientes, considera que de esta manera poco a poco podrá  tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Maria needs another loan to be able to buy corn, oil, fresh cheese, tomatoes, etc. in order to make and sell tortillas and pupusas [thick, stuffed corn tortillas]. In addition, she will acquire a variety of footwear and articles of clothing to sell as a street vendor. Her wish is to continue working and take advantage of the coming months, which are good for selling her products.

She is happy about the good experience that she has obtained from investing the previous loan in her business. She comments that she has greatly improved her competitiveness and the service to her customers. She feels that in this way, little by little, she will be able to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, fresh cheese, tomatoes, etc., to make and sell tortillas and pupusas. In addition, she will acquire footwear and articles of clothing to sell as a street vendor.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 50 years old and has five children who are presently in school.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 45 years old and has one child still in school.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like abaca and silk and to pay for maintenance for her weaving business.

Beverly has been in this business for ten years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like abaca and silk and to pay maintenance for her weaving business.

loans.name: Aura Yaneth

texts.es: A sus 26 años de edad Aura vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad, al que siempre buscan la manera de brindarle lo mejor. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos desde hace 4 años en una zona residencial y es gracias a ello que logra sostener la economía de su hogar. Aura desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda y construir la galera de enfrente, ya que actualmente solo ha colocado unas láminas deterioradas, para que la lluvia que azota no ingrese a su vivienda. Por lo anterior Aura solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir la galera y mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
At 26 years of age, Aura lives with her life partner and her 3-year-old son. They are always looking for the way to give him the best.

For the past 4 years, she has made a living by offering domestic services in a residential area. Thanks to this, she is able to support her household.

Aura wants to improve the roof of her house and build the porch in front, because right now she has only set up some deteriorated metal sheets so that the driving rain doesn't enter the house. For this, Aura is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to build the porch and improve her house's roof.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood, nails, and wire to build the porch and improve her house's roof

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
As a farmer from Santuk District, Kampong Thom Province, Heang, 64 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near his house. He is a hard-working father of ten children, seven of whom are married. He can earn approximately 2.5 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that he has done for more than twenty years.

In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, Heang is borrowing some money via Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.

He hopes that this assistance will help to improve his living conditions. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy some farm supplies

loans.name: Melati Setapak Group

texts.en:
The Melati Setapak Group is composed of five members. Erasmus, (in the middle) 47 years old, is the only man in the group and representative of the group on Kiva. He lives with his wife, Katarina, a 39- year-old woman.

Erasmus is working as a motorcycle taxi driver. Meanwhile, Katarina uses her sewing skill to make more income. Since the death of their baby three years ago, Erasmus has allowed his wife to spend her days with a clothes sewing business so she does not have to be sad for too long.

Erasmus wants to help his wife by buying a sewing machine with dynamo, yards, needles and fabric, since she still uses the old manual sewing machine. Unfortunately he does not have enough money to make it happen.

One day, an Account Officer introduced the group loan product to him and some people in his village. Erasmus and four women were interested to the group loan. He has been waiting for this opportunity to help his wife. They formed the Melati Setapak Group and requested a loan totaling IDR 15,000,000 from TLM. He is sure the loan provided by Kiva through TLM will make his wife’s dream come true.

Other members would like to spend their parts for their own businesses, such as selling cakes, phone credits, a kiosk and fried cakes.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine with dynamo,  yard, needles and fabric.

loans.name: Ma. Rebecca

texts.en:
Ma. Rebecca is a hard-working woman who earns a living through weaving baskets. She weaves baskets and other native decorative items made of buri (palm). Aside from basket weaving, she also raises and sells hogs.

She is 30-year-old married woman and has three children ages 10, 7, and 5 years old respectively.

She lives in the rural town of Antequera, Bohol. She has been weaving baskets for seven years now. She needs additional funds to continue improve her both sources of income.

Ma. Rebecca has requested a loan to buy materials like buli (palm), wicker (pliable twig) and pig feed. These will help improve her business. In that way, she could continue produce more baskets and raise quality livestock ,too.

With her previous loan, Ma. Rebecca managed to invest in her basket weaving livelihood, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy materials like buli (palm), wicker (pliable twig), and pig feed.

loans.name: Sulpecia

texts.en:
Sulpecia is 59 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Sulpecia has been raising pigs for 12 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 63 years old and is married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

Roselyn has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 53 years old and has 13 children. She is married and has four children who are still in school.

Clara is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Clara has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 51 years old; she is married with four children.

Betty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products.

Betty has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Betty aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, snack foods, eggs, bread, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline who, at the age of 39, has a small parcel of land. She is a very hardworking, honest, and warm-hearted farmer who hails from the Kabseba, Kapsowar area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth for farming.

She is the proud mother of a lovely family whom she adores and always protects. Caroline’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming six years ago. Through farming, she has been able to earn a decent income. Caroline is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life. She also has a side business with her shop.

Caroline is seeking a loan to buy seeds so she can start horticultural farming and so she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticulture farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman smallholder farmer, but Caroline is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change.

Through the income from horticulture farming Caroline will assure her children a bright future and will be able to pay the tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

For Caroline, nothing is impossible. She wants to continue working to fulfill her dream of becoming the largest horticulture farmer so that she can enjoy a good quality life.

loans.use: to buy seeds so she can start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 30 years old, married, and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Catherine has been farming vegetables for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Prech

texts.en:
Prech is 57 years old, living in a bed-room house located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, and she has four children, one of whom is a dependent child.

Growing cassava and mango have been the primary sources of her family’s income for 13 years. Unfortunately, her crop has been destroyed by insects, which causes her to earn lower income. She can save around 4 USD each day after offsetting her expenses.

This is Prech’s fourth loan with VisionFund and she will use it to save her business. The past loans have helped her to have enough household consumption to use. She is now applying for a new loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to enhance the productivity of her crop and the rest of the money will be spent on farming materials.

She hopes to get more income so that she can afford to expand her current business and upgrade her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to enhance the productivity of her crop so that she can afford to expand her current business.

loans.name: Serafina

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora  Serafina, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia continua  dedicándose al negocio de planchado y pintura para vehículos motorizados, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mezclador de pintura entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower is named Serafina. She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II" from the city of Cusco, Peru.

She continues to work in her auto body repair and paint business. She is an enterprising woman, who hopes to be able to earn more income through her work, in order to continue supporting her family.

She is grateful for the loan she was given and she commits to making all the required payments, as this is how she supports her family. She is requesting the loan to buy a paint mixer, among other things.

loans.use: to buy a paint mixer, among other things

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Eduarda, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
 La socia sigue   dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, papas, carnes  entre otros.
texts.en:
The member is Eduarda. She belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II” in the city of Cusco, Peru.
She continues working in the sale of food as a street vendor. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, with her work, hopes to obtain a bigger income and in this way continue supporting her family. She has had her business for some time, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She is grateful for the given loan and is committed to meeting the established fees.
She asks for the loan for the purchase of rice, potatoes, meats, among others.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, meats, among others.

loans.name: Yên's Group

texts.en:
Yên is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, this region often suffers natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

She has operated a food stall selling processed seafood for four years. The main hardship that Yên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to process seafood for sale.

This is Yên's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of Yên's group, which consists of five members.

With her business profit, she hopes to maintain a successful business, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to process seafood for sale.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is still married and she has very high interest in doing business; she has been involved in business activities since 2013. She started with her own working capital of $250, and she does her best with it.

She has a small store so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital because her capital is not enough. She will used this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including detergents, cooking oils, noodles, candles, sugar, soaps, hand and body lotion, pens, candies, cigarettes, hard drinks and other things to sell.

She still wants to improve her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy detergents, cooking oils, noodles, candles, sugar, soaps, hand and body lotion, pens, candies, cigarettes, hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Seda

texts.en:
Seda is farmer with many years of experience. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren.

Currently her husband and son working in construction as a migrant workers, and Seda has to take care of the farm alone. She keeps livestock of pigs, piglets, hens and turkeys, as well as cultivates potatoes, corn and wheat.

Seda requested this loan to cover the renovation of the agro machinery, forage for feeding the livestock, and renovation of the barn for keeping the livestock in the coming winter season.

Seda will greatly appreciate lenders' support to sustain her farming business and see it developed in the future.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the agro machinery, forage for feeding the livestock, and renovation of the barn for keeping the livestock in coming winter season

loans.name: Saholinirina

texts.fr:
Saholinirina a 25 ans, elle est mariée. Le couple n’a pas encore d’enfants. Le mari travaille comme machiniste auprès d’une entreprise franche. 
Elle  produit et vend des galettes au coco depuis 2013. Avant, elle travaillait comme vendeuse mais elle a abandonné en raison du niveau de salaire. C’est sa mère qui l’a formée dans cette activité, avant, elle ne faisait que revendre les produits de l’activité de sa mère. L’épargne constituée à partir du salaire du conjoint a permis d’acquérir la première four qui est actuellement vétuste et de faible capacité d’où la décision d’acquérir un nouveau  et d’augmenter le stock de matières premières dans l’objectif de satisfaire les besoins des clients. Le nombre d’employés est de deux.
Le couple vit dans une maison louée. Le but est de pouvoir construire une maison et transformer la petite unité de pâtisserie en boulangerie.
texts.en:
Saholinirina is twenty-five years old. She is married. She and her husband do not have children yet. Her husband works as a mechanic for a free-export company.

She has produced and sold coconut pancakes since 2013. Before, she worked as a salesperson, but she quit because of salary level. Her mother trained her in this business; at first she only retailed her mother's products. Savings made on her husband's salary allowed her to purchase her first oven, which is old and lower quality; hence the decision to buy a new oven and to increase her stock of ingredients to meet customer demand. There are two employees.

The couple lives in a rented house. Their goal is to build a house and to transform her small pastry shop into a bakery.

loans.use: to buy an oven, flour, oil, and sugar.

loans.name: Jebaud Lestari Group

texts.en:
After passing the fifth period, the Jebaud Lestari group succeeded in paying off all the loans on time. During the loan period, they kept the pigs well, safe from disease, and grow healthily. The pigs always were fed with a nutrious feed and vitamins.

Ni Kadek sold all of her pigs and earned enough profit. She also became a piglet seller in her village. She’s very happy for the result. Her husband and all of her family feel the benefits. The children can go to school and the daily needs are met.

She said thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK, for supporting her business. One member decide to stop borrowing and resigned from the group after she had enough profit from her sales. Now she continues the pig business with her own money.

Evaluating the last period, the Jebaud Lestari group decided to continue their loan from MUK. They still need the loan to increase their business and they will stop after they all have enough savings to use as capital to run the business by themselves.

Ni Kadek use her loan to purchase four superior piglets. She hopes that in the next five months, the pigs will grow healthily and earn a satisfactory price. All the profits will be saved for capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase four superior piglets.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Con 56 años de edad Teresa muestra cada día sus deseos de salir adelante, ya que cuenta con una tienda de productos varios desde hace un año, lo cual le permite estar pendiente de su hogar y ganarse la vida. Ella vive junto a su esposo y su grupo familiar en vivienda de su propiedad desde hace 10 años. Teresa desea instalar portones y ventanas de hierro en su vivienda, ya que siente que no tiene mucha seguridad, sobre todo porque son de madera y lámina sencilla, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: portones y ventanas para proteger mejor su vivienda y brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: At 56 years old, Teresa shows her dreams of getting ahead every day. Since a year ago, she has had a general store, which allows her to take care of her home and make a living. She lives together with her husband and family in housing that has been her property for the last 10 years. Teresa hopes to install gates and iron windows in her home, as she feels that she does not have a lot of safety, above all because they are currently made of wood and simple metal plates. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy gates and windows, to better protect her home and bring safety to her family.

loans.use: to buy gates and windows to better protect her home and bring safety to her family.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El socio es el señor  Sergio, él pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
El socio Sergio sigue dedicándose a brindar el  servicio de taxi, el  socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de llantas.
El socio Sergio agradece a  KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y mantenerse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
This borrower is named Sergio, and he belongs to the communal bank "Señor de los Temblores II" from the city of Cusco, Peru.

He continues to make a living by providing taxi services. He has been in the business for quite some time, and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts into his work every day.

He is grateful for the provided loan, and he commits to making his loan payments. He is requesting the loan to buy tires.

Sergio thanks Kiva for allowing him to develop and maintain his business activity.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 33 years old and has two children. Melona is married and has two children who are in school.

Melona is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melona requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melona has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Melona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sisca

texts.en:
Sisca is a businesswomen and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of $ 600.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as salts, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, water, cigarettes, eggs, noodles, nuts, sugar, soft drinks and other things to sell.

Sisca opened her kiosk a few year ago, with her own working capital. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin so that she can have more working capital to buy more goods. She will keep her spirit to run her business with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

loans.use: to buy salts, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, water, cigarettes, eggs, noodles, nuts, sugar, soft drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda has been involved in activities since a few years ago. She started her business with her own working capital. She was married and she is a business women. Her husband is a agricultural worker, so her husband is very supportive of her doing business.

Elda has a kiosk in her house, so many people come to buy from it. So now she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 because she wants to buy more items for her customers, such as rice, detergent, noodles, nuts, biscuits, milks, glue, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

She is very hopeful that, with this loan, she can be improving her management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, detergent, noodles, nuts, biscuits, milks, glue, cigarettes, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Yanira Marisol

texts.es: Yanira cuenta con 38 años de edad y vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo, al que cuida con mucho cariño. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una institución municipal, además cuenta siempre con el apoyo de su compañero de vida.  Yanira logro con el crédito anterior mejorar una parte del techo de su vivienda, por lo que solo le falta mejorar el techo de la entrada, el cual es bastante pequeño, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir el techo de la entrada de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yanira is 38 years old and lives with her life partner and her son, who she takes care of with a lot of love. Her occupation is to provide services in a municipal institution. She can also always count with the support of her life partner.
With the previous loan, Yanira managed to improve a section of the roof of her house, which is why she only needs to improve the roof at the entrance, which is quite small. This is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy zinc-coated steel sheet, wood, nails, and wire to build the roof at the entrance of her house.

loans.use: to buy zinc-coated steel sheet, wood, nails, and wire to build the roof at the entrance of her house.

loans.name: Jenny Julieta

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Jenny, ella pertenece al banco “Señor de los Temblores II” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. 
La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera poder con su trabajo obtener más ganancias para de esta continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le v a bien gracias  al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, menestras, papas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member's name is Ms. Jenny. She is part of the communal bank, “Señor de los Temblores II” in the city of Cusco – Perú.

Jenny continues to work in her business of selling food. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to obtain more earnings so that she can continue to support her family. For a long time she has worked in this business, which has been going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day.

She feels grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the repayments on schedule. She requests the loan to buy oil, mixed vegetables, and potatoes among others.

loans.use: to buy oil, mixed vegetables, and potatoes among others

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita engages in food vending and prepares snack food like banana cue (fried banana with caramelized sugar in bamboo skewer), bread and ice candy. She is a married woman and has two grown children. Her husband earns a living by driving a tricycle (rickshaw). Aside from food vending, she weaves native baskets made of buri (palm) to cater to the household expenses.

She has requested a loan to buy ingredients like flour and banana, and materials like buli, nito (kinds of palm) and wicker (pliable twig). In that way, it would help improve her productivity in producing more native baskets and enable her to continue to provide a variety of snack foods as well.

For the future, Julita is looking forward to continuing to expand both of her sources of income to become sustainable and to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour and bananas, and materials like buli, nito (kinds of palm) and wicker (pliable twig).

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 50 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Alma has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to resell.

Alma has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to resell.

loans.name: Silvia Marlene

texts.es:
Silvia, es una joven soltera y sin hijos, su única responsabilidad es cubrir las necesidades de sus padres, no cuenta con ayuda de remesas, su fuente de ingresos es vender prendas de vestir para ambos sexos, trabaja con un horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde.
Para presentar un mejor inventario solicita un financiamiento que piensa utilizar en la compra de camisas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas y blusas, al surtir más su negocio podrá satisfacer con mayor facilidad las peticiones de sus clientes, el objetivo de Silvia es generar más ingresos para vivir mejor junto a sus padres y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
La visión que ella tiene es tener un negocio más competitivo e incrementar su cartera de clientes.
texts.en:
Silvia is a young single person, with no children; her only responsibility is to meet the needs of her. She does not count on help from remittances; her source of income is selling clothing for both sexes, working with the schedule of seven in the morning to four in the afternoon.

To provide a better inventory, she is requesting a loan that she plans to use to purchase shirts, dresses, pants, skirts and blouses; to stock up her business so she may satisfy the demands of her customers with greater ease. Silvia’s aim is to generate more income in order to live better with her parents and pay down some acquired debt.

The vision that Silvia has is to have a more competitive business and to increase her customer base.

loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, pants, skirts and blouses; to stock up her business so she may satisfy the demands of her customers with greater ease.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been involved in business activities for a few years. She started her business with her own working capital. Maria sells traditional items that she buys from local people, then resells at the market. She is happy to do this because it's become her business activity. Maria is now requesting a loan of US $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more traditional items to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can expand her business in the future, and her income can increase.

loans.use: To buy traditional items to sell.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a 43-year-old farmer from a remote village in Tumaini in the Chuka area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Jeniffer passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and will lay more eggs.

Jeniffer is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

In addition to profits, Jeniffer will benefit from chicken manure fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Jeniffer will succeed in making her dreams come true. Take action and give a loan! She intends on becoming the biggest chicken provider in her village.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Budhvara's Group

texts.en:
Budhvara, standing on the left hand side in the photograph, is a divorcee. She hails from a village in the Korba district, Chattisgarh, India. She is a blessed mother of one daughter and takes care of her single handedly. She has never made her daughter feel the absence of her father. This lady with immense patience and strong willpower is engaged in embroidery work. She uses her skills learned from her mother by embroidering beautiful designs on duppatas, cushion covers and bedsheets. Her product has created a craze among her customers due to the unique beauty of her embroidery.

To make her business flourish and meet the increasing demands of the customer, Budhvara along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. Budhvara will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase beads, ribbons, colored fabrics, colored stones and other raw materials in bulk.

The loan amount will subsequently enable Budhvara to expand her outreach of customers and enjoy a better standard of living. Budhvara is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to purchase beads, ribbons, colored fabrics, colored stones and other raw materials in bulk.

loans.name: Komal

texts.en:
Komal is a 25-year-old woman living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving it and is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Komal has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers so he can drive the rickshaw smoothly. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income.

Komal is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body and seat covers for her husband's transportation service.

loans.name: Dúo Antonieta De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Antonieta de Vista Hermosa La encargada de este grupo es la señora Maria Antonieta de 51 años de edad, vive al lado de sus dos hijos quienes la apoyan en todo y es dueña de una venta de regalos para toda ocasión como peluches, estuches de colonias, lámparas, platos con mensaje, tazas con dulces, cuadros en general,  desde hace 8 años la cual está ubicada en la calle principal de su Colonia.  Su sueño es tener un local propio y así dejar de arrendar para tener más ganancias y seguir apoyando a su hijo en sus estudios para algún día verlo un hombre profesional y de bien.  Las fiestas de graduación se aproximan  y los clientes ya le están preguntando que regalos traerá a la venta, por tal motivo ella necesita otro crédito para comprar lo que le hace falta y no quedarles mal a sus clientes.  Ella está muy agradecida por las oportunidades que se le dan a pesar de la distancia y les envía muchas bendiciones por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Dúo Antonieta de Vista Hermosa. Maria Atonieta, who is 51 years old, is in charge of this group. She lives with her two children, who support her with everything, and she runs a store where she sells gifts for every occasion, such as stuffed animals, perfume sets, lamps, plates with messages, cups with candy, paintings in general, etc. The store is located in the main street of her neighborhood.
Her dream is to have her own store and stop renting to have more income and continue supporting her son with his studies, to see him one day as a professional and well-off man. The graduation celebrations are coming closer, and clients are already asking about what type of gifts she will be selling. For this reason, she needs another loan to buy what she needs and not disappoint her clients.
She is very grateful for the opportunities that are given to her, in spite of the distance, and she sends you many blessings for your help.

loans.use: to buy gifts to sell.

loans.name: Soknai

texts.en: Soknai is 18 years old and single. He is a college freshman. He resides in the Tboung Khmum province in Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers and practice animal husbandry. Soknai is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking at a university in the province. Currently, he lacks the money to pay his university fees for the first to the fourth year, so he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to earn a bachelor’s degree successfully and earn skills for his future job. For his future dreams, Soknai wants to work in a financial institution with a reasonable salary, so he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his university fees for the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leny is 37 years old and all three children are enrolled in school.

Leny has a general store business in the Philippines. Leny requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like sugar, shampoo, and noodles.

Leny has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Leny would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sugar, shampoo, and noodles.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like sugar, noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like charcoal retailing business.

Elsie dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, noodles, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa has been involved in a business activity for a few years, with her own working capita. She is married and she is a businesswoman. She is also one of the entrepreneurs and her business is selling cows. Her husband is in agriculture, so her husband is very supportive of selling the cows. So now she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to their capital to buy more cows because she wants to change her business to a big one. She was very happy with the loan that was offered by Tuba Rai Metin because she can increase her income in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in Kaplamai in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities.

Sarah is happily married and the proud mother of three children, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs and milk.

Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good quality seeds.

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming. This loan will help Sarah to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, aged 45, is a responsible mother living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her sixth loan with BRAC Pakistan and her first with Kiva. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods and waste papers from the common people and sells the goods to the recycling factories. Nowadays due to household expenses, he does not have money to buy scrap goods and does not have scrap to sell to generate money.

Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and earn some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents. She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap good for her husband's shop where he sells and purchases scrap goods.

loans.name: Azoka Group

texts.en:
Adelina (standing on the left and wearing the grey t-shirt), 33 years old, is a mother of three children with ages between 15 and 3 years old. Two of her children are attending school.

Besides being a housewife, Adelina also supports her husband in generating more income by doing weaving. By spending 5-6 hours a day, Adelina is able to complete a nice woven cloth with an average size of 150 x 120 cm in a month. From that business, she can earn a net income of IDR 500,000 – 700,000 per month.

Adelina desires to increase her income by weaving more woven cloths with different patterns and different colours as well. In order to make her plan comes true, Adelina and two neighbors requested a loan from TLM totaling IDR 7,500,000. This loan will help Adelina to buy yarn in bulk. Just like Adelina, both Yohana and Romana would like to use their part for investing in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy yarn in bulk

loans.name: Chern

texts.en:
Chern is a 20-year-old single student who is pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree, majoring in marketing. He is in his first year. Chern lives in the Tboung Khmum Province of Cambodia. His family are rice farmers and they totally depend on farming for revenue.

He is short of finances to pay his tuition fees for the first to the fourth year. Therefore, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to earn his Bachelor’s Degree successfully.

In the future, Chern is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary and this will help him to build a proper house. If he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue a Bachelor's or Master's degree if he can support that.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees for the first to the fourth year

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en: Anastacia resides in Badian, Cebu. This town is two hours away from Cebu City, with stretches of lands cultivated by the people who are farmers. Anastacia, on the other hand, is raising hogs and cattle to make both ends meet while her husband is a farmer. She is asking for a loan to buy feed so she can make her hogs healthy. She is optimistic with the result of the loan since it will allow her to buy sacks of feed for her hogs and let her save money from fare if she has to buy it on a per-kilo basis. Anastacia aims to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Je-Ann

texts.en:
Je-ann is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and all three children are enrolled in school.

Je-ann is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Je-ann requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and repair her pig-pens.

Je-ann has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Je-ann would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and repair her pigpens.

loans.name: Ruvelyn

texts.en:
Ruvelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Ruvelyn dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan to further build her business.

Concepcion dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to customers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Mary, 36 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Ruiru, a remote village in Thika. She is happily married and has two children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling goat milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland.

Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market. This will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying back the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is a working woman, aged 37, and the mother of six children. Her husband also works but that was not sufficient for the family. So five years ago, Samina started her embroidery business. This helped the family with their financial needs. The response from her customers was very encouraging. Samina wants to invest more in her business in order to get bigger returns to manage her domestic finances. She wants her business to flourish. She is thankful to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to  invest in her embroidery business

loans.name: Ratha

texts.en:
Ratha is 32 years old and works very hard on a small rice field which is far away from her house in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. With her husband, the daily profit for her house is USD 4 a day. So far, she has been a farmer for about 15 years.

Currently, Ratha needs some money to buy a motorbike to ride to her workplaces, because she can’t afford to buy one. Therefore, now she would like to get a Kiva loan to help buy the motorbike. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to her workplaces.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells merchandise like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries. Aside from operating a sari-sari (variety) store, she weaves native baskets, which serve as additional income. Her husband is a carpenter. His income could be a great help to the household expenses. She is married and has four children, two of whom are still attending school.

She has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for five years, serving neighbors and local settlers in her place. She would like to improve her earnings to have adequate supplies of store merchandise. These will keep up the inventory of her store, causing more buyers to shop.

Juliet has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries and supplies like flour and sugar. These are tools that could augment her financial income. Thus, she could continue to provide for the needs of her family and start to expand her sources of income.

She is hoping that she could be able to mange both of her sources of income to become more sustainable. Juliet is hoping that she could make it sustainable for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries and supplies like flour and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Edit

texts.es:
María se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para poder hacer la compra de harina, huevos, manteca, vainilla, etc., para elaborar la venta de pan, asimismo invertirá en pan dulce para revender, considera que le será de mucho beneficio para que su negocio siga con vida.
Para María el utilizar los créditos como herramientas de progreso le ha dado resultados positivos, ya que en la actualidad en su negocio ofrece otro tipo de pan, tiene más clientes y puede ayudar a su hijo con los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
María sees the necessity to request a new loan to buy flour, eggs, butter, vanilla, etc. to prepare bread for sale. She will also invest in buying sweet bread for resale. She considers the loan a great help for her business to flourish.

As María uses the loans as a tool for progress, it has given her positive results. Recently her business has offered another type of bread and now it has more customers. This way María can help her son with his living costs.

loans.use: buy flour, eggs, butter, vanilla, etc. to prepare bread for sale, and to buy sweet bread for resale

loans.name: Chhat's Group

texts.en:
Chhat, standing on the right, is a 29-year-old hardworking and optimistic housewife. She lives with her husband and their five-year-old son in a small village in Korba, Chattisgarh, India. She started her own sewing business so that she could provide her son with a better education than the primary schooling she had. She, being a differently abled lady, has never stepped back in order to achieve her dreams and supplement her husband's earnings.

Chhat's husband is a farmer whose earnings are very scant. Chhat supplements her husband's income by sewing and selling clothes to her villagers. She supports her family with the income she earns by sewing clothes like dresses, blouses, shirts, frocks, etc. Her small business brings a good monthly income and she diligently saves a small part of this, running her home with the rest of her income supported by the income her husband brings in.

Aware that these savings will be insufficient, she is working to increase her business earning potential. To improve her productivity and take on more customers, she wants to buy a new and better sewing machine. To put this plan into action, Chhat needs access to funds. So, she along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum.

Chhat will use her portion of the loan to buy a new sewing machine and hopes she will be able to cater to more customers. She will use this significant boost in her savings to educate her son and invest in the further growth of her business.

She expresses her gratitude to her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 61-year-old mother of three children. Razia's husband has been running a tire shop for 15 years and, because of his humble nature, he is very popular in the market and also caters to several customers at a time. He is much experienced in this business and now wants to invest more into the business, so following her husband's achievements and dreams, she applied for the loan amount and is very much thankful to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To invest in her husband's tire shop.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina cada día pone todo su esfuerzo por sacar adelante a su familia, ella vive con su esposo en vivienda propia y sencilla desde hace 9 años. Ella tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año, lo cual le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Anteriormente Rosalina solicito un crédito el cual utilizo en la construcción del corredor de su vivienda, algo que la hace sentir muy feliz, por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI el cual utilizara para comprar: cemento, tuberías, pila y lavadero y mano de obra para instalar agua potable en su vivienda, y cuidar de la sanidad de su hogar.
texts.en:
Every day, Rosalina puts all her effort to get ahead with her family. She lives with her husband in their own simple house since 9 years ago. She is 44 years old, and she sells clothes for work, which she has been doing for one year. This activity lets her sustain her household.

Previously, Rosalina requested a loan which she used in the construction of a hallway in her house, something that has made her feel very happy. For this, she is requesting a new loan to FUSAI, which she will utilize to buy cement, tubes, battery, sink, as well as manual labor to install drinking water in her house and to take care of the hygiene of her household.

loans.use: to buy cement, tubes, battery, a sink, and manual labor to install drinking water in her house and to take care of the hygiene of her household

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is engaged in a hog raising business in Badian, Cebu. She manages to keep her hogs in a small wooden barn. Carmelita started this business eight years ago and she has been consistently improving. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed. This loan will give her ample time to continue raising hogs and give them enough feed for their proper growth. In the future, she hopes to build a big, concrete barn while continue sending her four children to school.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 42 years old and has two children.  Rosalie is married and has one child still in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Rosalie has been in this business for 11 years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a kind-hearted mum, and also very well-organized, industrious, and entrepreneurial. She is 39 years of age, hardworking and energetic. She hails from the Mbururu Kitale area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good climatic conditions and favorable weather patterns that favor farming.
