Comprará insecticidas, herbicidas y abono para realizar la siembra de maíz en la nueva temporada, con el financiamiento tendrá los recursos necesarios para mantener la continuidad de su negocio, espera tener una mayor cosecha y que no sea afectada por las plagas.
Sus sueños son ofrecerle a su grupo familiar una vida más confortable y poder financiarle los estudios a su hija para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and their daughter in their own home. Due to the need for additional income sources to supply the family needs, she decided to apply what her parents taught her a long time ago. This is what has led her to currently farm corn to feed her family and to be able to sell. She also has a small store with miscellaneous goods.

She will purchase insecticides, herbicides and fertilizer to plant corn in the new season. With the financing, she will have the necessary resources to maintain her business. She hopes to have a bigger harvest and that it not be affected by plagues.

Her dreams are to offer her family unit a more comfortable life and be able to finance her daughter's studies so she has a better future.

loans.use: purchase insecticides, herbicides and fertilizer in order to plant corn in the new season

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel de 50 años se dedica al cultivo de café desde hace 28 años, él vive en la comunidad de Intibucá, Honduras. Además de la agricultura  también se dedica a la distribución de lámparas Solares en las comunidades que no cuentan con servicio de energía eléctrica con lo cual el genera un ingreso adicional que le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ya que él desea dar a su esposa y dos hijos, mejores condiciones de vida. Una de las metas de Miguel es poder dar a sus hijos la educación a la que el no tuvo acceso, por esa razón ha decidido solicitar a Soluz Honduras el financiamiento para la compra de estas Lámparas solares y de esa manera también estará contribuyendo a mejorar el nivel de vida de muchas personas brindándoles acceso al uso de energía y comunicación.
texts.en:
Miguel is 50 years old and has grown coffee for 28 years. He lives in the community of Intibuca, in Honduras. 

Besides agriculture he also works distributing solar lamps in the communities that have no electric power distribution, which generates additional income, helping him with household expenses. 

He wishes to provide his wife and two children with a better quality of life. One of Miguel's goals is to provide his children with the education he could not access. 

For this reason, he has decided to request Soluz Honduras for funds to purchase these solar lamps and, as a result, also contribute to improving the standard of living of many people, by giving them access to energy and communication.

loans.use: to distribute solar lamps in communities without access to electricity, which will generate additional income and improve his standard of living.

loans.name: Sonia Yanira

texts.es:
Sonia vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, son una familia unida y luchan por salir adelante, su fuente de ingresos principal es la compra y venta de semilla de marañón, ella es muy reconocida en su localidad por su negocio y por ser una persona honrada.
El financiamiento le servirá para comprar semilla de marañón en mayor cantidad y a un precio más bajo, con ello podrá atender los pedidos de sus clientes con puntualidad y además sus ganancias incrementarán, espera ampliar su mercado.
Sus aspiraciones son seguir trabajando como hasta ahora para tener un negocio más popular y al mismo tiempo enseñar a sus hijos a ser personas de bien y que puedan salir adelante de manera honesta.
texts.en:
Sonia lives with her life partner and their children. They are a tight-knit family and work hard to get ahead. Her main source of income is the buying and selling of cashew seeds. She is well known in the area for her business and for being an honorable person.

The financing will help her purchase cashew seeds in larger quantities and at a lower price. This will allow her to attend to her client's orders on time. Additionally her earnings will increase and she hopes to expand her market.

Her dreams are to continue her work as she has done up until now in order to have a more popular business and at the same time teach her children to be people of good and that they can get ahead in an honest manner.

loans.use: purchase cashew seed in larger quantities and at a lower price, this allows her to attend to her client's orders on time.

loans.name: Zeboniso

texts.ru: Зебонисо женщина из района Вахш. Зебонисо заниматься растениеводством. Ее работа приносит в дом важный источник дохода. В работе ей помогает тесть. У Зебонисо имеется 1 Га земельный участок. Зебонисо замужем и имеет 2 и 3 летных детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Зебонисо обратилась за кредитом, потому что сейчас ей срочно необходимо посеять новый урожай. На заемные деньги она купить минеральные удобрений. Зебонисо нуждается в деньгах. Для Зебонисо важна каждая помощь.
texts.en:
Zeboniso is a woman from the Vakhsh region and she is in the farming business.  Her work is a very important source of income for her family.  Zeboniso is married and has two children, two and three years old.  Her husband went to the Russian Federation to find work.  Zeboniso has 1 hectare of land and her father-in-law helps her with her work.

Zeboniso has applied for a loan because she urgently needs to sow seeds now for her next harvest.  She is going to use the borrowed money to buy mineral fertilizers.  She needs money and any help is important.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 37-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good, and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single source of income, her husband, who drives an auto rickshaw.
She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son. He has collected funds, but is short of the total amount needed. He will assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker.
Shakeela is requesting this loan for her son, so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. She will encourage her son to drive his new rickshaw, and generate income for her family.
Shakeela hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional rickshaw for her son, so he can generate income like his father does.

loans.name: Marhobo

texts.ru: Мархобо молодая и миролюбивая девушка из района Вахш. Ей 20 лет. Мархобо живет с мамой, отцом, сестрой и братом. Она младшая в семье. Так же от мамы она получила талант шитья. Мархобо очень талантливая девушка. Она создает все новые и новые платья и вкладывает в каждую из них кусочку своей души. Мархобо хочет стать профессионалом своего дела и быть успешным человеком. Она не продвинется столь далеко, чтобы достичь своей цели, если у нее не будет хорошего оборудования. Ее швейная машинка старая, часто ломается в процессе работы и приносит много не удобств. Мархобо с разрешением матери обратилась за кредитом, надеясь на поддержку.  За счет кредита она купить новую многофункциональную швейную машинку.
texts.en:
Marhobo is a young and amicable woman from the Vakhsh region.  She is 20 years old and lives with her mother, father, sister, and brother.  She is the youngest in the family.  Marhobo inherited a talent for sewing from her mother.  She is a very gifted young lady who creates ever newer dresses, putting a little piece of her heart into each of them.  

Marhobo wants to become a professional in her field and to be a successful person.  Her goal would be within reach if she had good equipment.  Her sewing machine is old, often breaks down while she is sewing, and has causes many inconveniences.  With her mother's permission, Marhobo has applied for a loan, hoping for support.  She will use the loan to buy a new, multi-function sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a multi-function sewing machine

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en: Adoracion is 60 years old, widowed and has six children. She sells a variety of snacks to make a living. She offers them to offices, schools and nearby establishments. She wanted to improve her sales and profits, so she sells snacks daily.  She is now asking for an additional capital of P25,000, to buy more rice cakes, bread and peanuts. She hopes to continue selling snacks and save funds for any future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy rice cakes, bread and peanuts to re-sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 60 years old, married, with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Nora has a general store business in the Philippines. Nora has requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Nora has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nora would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, está casada, es madre de tres hijos, pero vive únicamente con dos de ellos y depende de ella, dice no tener familiares en el extranjero; trabaja de manera independiente en la venta de frutas y verduras, su horario de trabajo es de cinco de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, su ventaja es que cuenta con varios años de experiencia y aprendió el oficio con ayuda de su familia.
Piensa invertir el crédito en la compra de manzanas, guineos, güisquiles, papas, pepinos, tomates, uvas, etc., ofrecerá un inventario más surtido a sus clientes, con lo que considera que las ventas e ingresos serán mejores.
Rosa trabaja muy duro para concretar su sueño  de ampliar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda para darle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is married, has three children, two of them dependents, and no family abroad. She is self-employed in the sale of fruits and vegetables and her working hours are from five am to four pm. To her advantage she has several years of experience and she learned the trade with the help of her family. 

She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of apples, bananas, chayote fruit, potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, grapes, etc. By providing a more assorted stock to her customers she expects that her sales and income will improve. 

Rosa works very hard to realize her dream of expanding her business and improving her home, to provide her family with a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, chayote fruit, potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes, grapes, etc., offering a more assorted stock to her customers.

loans.name: Fathi

texts.en:
Fathi  is a 22-year-old, single man lives in Irbid, he is studying his Bachelor degree in Drama in his second year. Fathi`s ‎problem is financial difficulties of his family, therefore he decided to apply for an educational loan to help him pay for his ‎university fees and achieve his dream.‎
Fathi has a future plan to open art center in his village. ‎

loans.use: to cover his university fees, where he is studying Drama and achieve his goals.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a married woman from the town of Badian, Cebu. She is a mother of two teenagers. Her husband is a farmer who works hard to support their family. Rebecca engages in raising hogs to help augment the income of their household. She has earned a living through her hog-raising business for nine years now. She is asking for a loan to buy feed. Through this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her business, which will allow her to supplement her husband's income. She wants to expand her business and increase business profitability while supporting her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy feed to improve the productivity of her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es una humilde mujer de 55 años de edad, que día tras día sale a empujar su carro de perros calientes (snacks).
Ella vive en un humilde hogar, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad y con familia, solo están ella y su pareja.
La cliente actualmente se encuentra solicitando un apoyo para comprar materiales con los cuales adecuar el carro, buscando mayor comodidad y facilidad para transportarse.
Quiere cambiar las llantas desgastadas, frenos, algunos enseres, la plancha y comprar surtido de empaques, vasos plásticos, refrescos e insumos para preparar perros calientes.
texts.en:
Juana is a humble 55 year old woman, who goes out every day to push her hot dog cart around.

She lives in a humble home, she has two children who are now grown up with their own families, so it is just her and her partner at home.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy materials to improve her cart, as she is looking to make it easier and more comfortable to transport. She wants to change the worn-out tires, breaks, some equipment, and the griddle, as well as a selection of items, plastic cups, soft drinks and ingredients for the hot dogs.

loans.use: a selection of items, plastic cups, soft drinks and ingredients for the hot dogs.

loans.name: Derrick

texts.en:
Derrick is 38 years old and a farmer at Mariakani, Kenya. For the last 20 years, he has supplied the residents of Mariakani with green maize and green vegetables with the support of his spouse. Together, they are blessed with two children, and their business is doing great.

This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for replanting, and he will use the anticipated profit to lease more land for growing maize. He hopes to harvest more maize in his farm and have a more successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and maize seeds.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chanthou works as farmer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Chanthou (and her group member) to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is maize farmer from Jaki village.

As a member of Babban Gona, Emmanuel is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Emmanuel is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. He hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saher

texts.en:
Saher is a 21-year-old Palestinian from Gaza. He is single and living with his parents.

Saher started his fishing business three years ago by buying an old fishing boat and fishing net as he loves this kind of work. His main challenges are the Israeli siege and the changeable weather conditions.

Saher requested this loan from (ACAD) to repair his fishing net and to buy a new motor for his old fishing boat. The extra income from this loan will help Saher to improve his parent's standards of living.

In the future, Saher is looking to expand his business by buying a new boat and a new fishing net. He thanks Kiva and ACAD for this chance to share his story.

loans.use: to repair the fishing net and to buy a new motor for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Rum's Group

texts.en:
Rum’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Rum makes a living cultivating rice to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Rum (and his group members) to safeguard the health of his family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Shabnam

texts.en:
Shabnam's age is 32; she is married and living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her financial condition is neither good nor bad, her husband does not earn enough to contribute to household expenses.

He is a furniture maker and makes very fine furniture, such as wooden beds, chairs, tables, cots, etc. He has been running this business for 15 years and has a lot of experience. 

In the last few days, her husband has become sick, and most of the savings have been spent on his medical treatment. Now he is healed and hearty but does not have amount to buy raw material for making furniture. Therefore, Shabnam requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue, chip boards, etc., to continue his business.

Shabnam thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan and feels happy after this loan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as wooden planks, nails, glue, and chip boards for her husband's furniture-making business.

loans.name: Vision Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Hannah. She is 42 years old, married, and blessed with three children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2015 and underwent training on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management, and she is now able to advance her dairy farming through proper recording and prudent finance management.

Hannah is borrowing a kiva loan to purchase quality fodder. This will boost milk productivity and lead to more income, which she will use in providing food, providing clothing, and paying school fees for children.

She appreciates the support and has promised to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase quality fodder. This will boost milk productivity and income, which Hannah will use in providing food, providing clothing, and paying school fees for children.

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru: Мирали 52 года. Он очень добрый и чуткий человек. У Мирали четверо детей. Он многодетный отец. Он работает охранником на рынке. Его работа приносит хороший доход. У Мирали есть жена. Его жена работает медсестрой в больнице. Его поступки заслуживают уважения. По истечению обстоятельств он не в состоянии оплатить обучение своего сына в институте. Поэтому он просит Вас дать ему в кредит нужную сумму для оплаты договора. Мирали надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mirali is 52. He is a very kind and sensitive person. He has four children and works as a security guard at the market. His work brings in good income. He has a wife who works as a nurse in a hospital. Her actions deserve respect.

Due to certain circumstances, Mirali is unable to pay for his son's post-secondary education. Therefore he is asking you to give him a loan of the necessary sum so he can pay what is owed. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for his son's post-secondary education

loans.name: Kurbongul

texts.ru: Курбонгул жительница Яванского района. Ей 49 лет она замужем и имеет очень большую семью состоящею из 10 человек. Три старших сына находятся на заработках в России. Сама Курбонгул вместе с мужем вот уже 15 лет занимаются разведением и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Так они обеспечивают свою семью. Однако этого недостаточно, так как семья большая и с каждым годом потребности ее растут. Курбонгул с мужем решили обратиться за кредитом и тем самым расширить свой бизнес и выдать дочку замуж.  Курбонгул надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Kurbongul is a resident of the Yavan region. She is 49 and married with a large family consisting of 10 people. Her three oldest sons are working in Russia. She and her husband have been working in agriculture and selling livestock for 15 years. In this way they care for their family. However, it is not enough, since their family is large and with every year their needs grow.

Kurbongul and her husband have decided to ask for a loan so they can expand their business and pay for their daughter's wedding. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to expand her agriculture and livestock-raising business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Food vendors are usually seen walking along the streets or just staying at one busy spot. Sometimes they have to run when policemen pursue them to get fines. Lucia, 51 years old, from Payatas, Quezon City is chasing the crowd in order to get higher sales. She sells homemade donuts to help sustain her family’s daily needs. Her husband Danilo is an on-call reflexologist. Both of them patiently work hard for the sake of their children, the youngest is studying in high school.

Lucia appeals for PHP 18,000 loan to buy ingredients like flour, milk, oil, margarine, and sugar for her food vending business. Hopefully, she can earn higher profit to sustain their needs and set aside some amount for the future. This may be one step forward in reaching her dream of a more stable business.

She also dreams of renovating their house, completing the college education of her children, and enjoying better living conditions someday. She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, milk, oil, margarine, and sugar for her food vending business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
A hardworking woman, honest, humble, and full of life--this how to describe Christine. She is a rural farmer in Naitiri, Kitale, Kenya, an area known for having bad terrain and a lack of proper infrastructure. She is blessed with a lovely family and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years.

On her farm, she grows maize and raises a dairy cow and poultry. She sells milk, eggs, and maize. To meet her expenses and provide the best for her family, she often engages in small personal businesses to make extra money. However, farming gives her a great sense of satisfaction, despite meager earnings.

Because of this challenge, Christine formed a group and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports small rural farmers. She acquired a dairy cow. The cow produces milk daily, which Christine sells to a co-operative. The money Christine got from selling the milk was adequate to repay the loan.

Today, Christine is seeking a new loan to buy another dairy cow because she is planning to become a full-fledged dairy farmer. Her future plan is to construct a zero-grazing unit. That way, she can use the grazing field to plant fodder and prepare silage. With this loan, Christine is going to grow into a very successful dairy farmer.

All she wants is for her family to enjoy the abundance of life, good health, and good livelihood. Her only dream is to continue growing her business and in the future to leave it to her children. Christine patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Evelyn Jeaneth

texts.es:
Evelyn, es una mujer que se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en su vehículo, sus recorridos los hace en su localidad y en sus alrededores, trabajando de esta manera ella puede cubrir gastos familiares, ella es acompañada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 6 años de edad, de los cuales solo uno depende económicamente de ella.
Ella está necesitando de un financiamiento para poder comprar diferentes tipos de frutas y verduras como: uvas, melones, pipianes, ejotes, papas, etc., otra parta le servirá para pagar algunas reparaciones de su vehículo, la finalidad de utilizar un crédito en este momento es surtir mejor su negocio y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Evelyn desea tener mejor estabilidad financiera para compartir con su núcleo familiar una vida más confortable y resarcir su deuda.
texts.en:
Evelyn is a woman who makes a living selling fruits and vegetables form her vehicle. She makes her rounds in her area and the surroundings. Working this way she is able to cover the family's expenses. She is accompanied and has two children ages 18 and 6. One of them depends economically on her.

She is needing financing to be able to purchase different types of fruits and vegetables such as: grapes, melons, squash, green beans, potatoes, etc. It will also be used to help pay for some repairs to her vehicle. The end goal of using the loan in this moment is to better stock her business and give a good service to her clients.

Evelyn wishes to have better financial stability to share a more comfortable life with her family unit and to pay off her debt.

loans.use: purchase different types of fruits and vegetables such as: grapes, melons, squash, green beans, potatoes, etc.  It will also help to pay for some repairs for her vehicle.

loans.name: Mai-Unguwa

texts.en:
Mai-Unguwa is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Mai-Unguwa is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mai-Unguwa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs, such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Mai-Unguwa can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mai-Unguwa no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mai-Unguwa hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Afet

texts.en:
Afet is married and a mother of two. After her children grew up, she opened a small shop, and she has been running it for ten years selling ornaments and trousseau.

She applied for the loan for its advantages. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy ornaments and trousseau, sell them and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff.

Afet hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Çocuklarını büyüttükten sonra küçük bir dükkan açmış, hediyelik eşya ve çeyiz üzerine on yıldır işletiyor. Mikro kredinin imkanlarından faydalanmak üzere başvurmuş. Aldığı mikro kredi ile dükkanına hediyelik eşya ve çeyiz malzemeleri alarak satarak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy ornaments and trousseau.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en: Leap’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Leap makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Sokha’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokha makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sokha (and her group members) to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Nhanh makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Nhanh (and her group members) to safeguard the health of her family and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Khudoynazar

texts.ru: Худойназару 51 год. Он веселый и уверенный в себе. Худойназар жител города Душанбе. Он 8 лет работал слесарем. У него два сына. Старшему 28 лет, а младшему 6 лет. Жена Худойназара швея. В данный момент  работает таксистом. В этой области он работает уже 15 лет. По словам Худойназара работа идет нормально и приносит хорошие доходы. Недавно у него сломалась машина. На починку машины ему нужна небольшая сумма. С такими планами Худойназар обратился за кредитом. Он надеется на вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Khudoynazar is 51 and a happy and self-confident resident of the city of Dushanbe. He has been working as a locksmith for eight years. He has two sons; the oldest is 28 and the youngest is six. His wife is a seamstress. 

At the moment, Khudoynazar is working as a taxi driver. He has been working in this area for 15 years. In his words, the work goes well and brings in good income. However, a while ago his car broke down and he needs a small amount of money to repair it. He is looking for a loan to do so and he hopes for your support.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 45-year-old married Palestinian refugee and a father of three, who has been working in construction business for 15 years. He lives and works in a refugee camp and is working hard to develop his business and improve his family's living.

He has a long experience in the cement work domain, since he started as an employee at a young age after he had to quit school during the elementary classes to support his family in their living.

Hassan is working on developing his business. His loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua is requested to buy a compressor and wood logs to develop his construction business and help him expand his working sector.

loans.use: to buy necessary compressor and wood logs to develop his construction business and help him expand his working sector.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora earns a living by engaging in a snack food vending business. She sells banana cue (deep fried banana with caramelized sugar on a bamboo skewer). Aside from that, she also sells chips, chocolates and biscuit to the neighbors in her place.

She is married and has two children, one of whom is still attending school. Her husband is a farmer. Together with her family, she lives in the town of Sierra Bullones, Bohol.

She would like to improve her main source of income to become more productive and improve the family’s living conditions.

Flora wants to purchase supplies like banana, flour and sugar. In this way, she could increase her output and slowly augment her daily earnings. Thus, she could now start to expand and invest her income to become successful.

She is thankful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like banana, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Vanessa Claire

texts.en:
Vanessa Claire is 34 years old and married with three children. She helps her husband in providing the needs of the family by engaging in a food cafeteria while her husband works abroad as an OFW. She earns better income from this business, and she was encouraged to improve her cafeteria since she earns better income from it.

Her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. She is taking this new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the children in the future and to buy house improvements for safer living.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: Ediza

texts.en:
Ediza is from the town of Badian. This municipality of Cebu is blessed with beautiful natural resources, tourist spots, beaches and waterfalls.

Ediza has operated a sari-sari (variety) store business for 11 years now. From her profit, she uses the money to pay for the school fees of her daughter, who is six years old.

Ediza is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, candies, snack foods, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries. With this stock, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and profit.

In the future, Ediza has hopes of making her business a success and saving money for reinvestment in the same venture.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, snack foods, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Sreyleing's Group

texts.en:
Sreyleing’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sreyleing makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Louv's Group

texts.en: Louv is a farmer living in a rural area of Siem Reap province.  She is 33 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school and one is younger. Growing rice and cassava have been the primary sources of her family’s income for 15 years. She has been working for others for a fee to make supplemental income. As the crop was not healthy enough to produce good yields, she can earn only about 6USD per day to support the family’s living. She can save around 3USD each day after offsetting expenses for the emergency needs. In order to save her business, she is now leading a small group to apply for a Kiva loan via VisionFund, to pay for hiring a tractor, to prepare the land to grow her cassava. She hopes that this loan will help her get a better yield and she can increase her income to upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for hiring a tractor, to prepare the land to grow cassava.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is the age of 43 and the mother of six children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Rehana has requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. He has been selling vegetables for many years, and he sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four-wheeled manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop to sell his vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy initial supplies to run his shop correctly.

The needs of his family have suddenly increased recently, and he does not have any other sources of income to cope with these needs. Therefore, he decided to expand his current business, and he wants to increase his stock so that he can maximize his vegetable sales every day.

Rehana has therefore requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy an initial stock of seasonal vegetables for his newly established green grocery shop.

Rehana thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy initial stock of green grocery inventory for her husband, so he can fully stock his newly setup shop.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vanny makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Vanny (and her group member) to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Reyna Concepcion

texts.es: Reyna es una mujer trabajadora de 53 años de edad que vive en casa propia al lado de su hijo de 25 años de edad al que siempre busca la manera de apoyar. Ella es una mujer admirable que se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir actividad que le permite sostener a su familia, además gracias a la calidad de sus costuras es muy reconocida y solicitada. Reyna desea construir el techo del área del lavadero y pila, además de colocarle una tapadera a la pila, ya que teme que sea anidación de mosquitos. Por lo anterior ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para colocar techo al área del lavadero y proteger la pila de los mosquitos.
texts.en:
Reyna is a hardworking woman aged 53, who lives in her own home with her 25 year old child whom she is always trying to support.

She is an admirable woman who works producing clothing, which allows her to sustain her family, and thanks to the quality of her sewing she is well recognized and sought after.

Reyna wishes to build the roof for the laundry and sink area, as well as installing a cover for the sink as she fears it being a nesting site for mosquitoes. To do this, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy: galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and wire to put up the roof in the laundry area and to protect the sink from the mosquitoes.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood, nails and wire to put up a roof in the laundry area and to protect the sink from the mosquitoes.

loans.name: Siyorn's Group

texts.en:
Siyorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Siyorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Chork's Group

texts.en:
Chork’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chork makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 30s, is single with two schooling children. She has been running a general store for two and a half years. She works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rose’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restore the out-of-stock items in the store and has managed to pay back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan.

She used the profit to pay school fees for her two kids, to repay the loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the general store. She dreams of building her own house.

She will be account table for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the general store.

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en:
Yim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does work as factory laborer and banker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Iliya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Iliya would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Iliya will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Iliya now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
Sum’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sum makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor and construction worker to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Pakize

texts.en:
Pakize is divorced and living with her two children. She served as a nurse in hospitals for 20 years and retired. She got bored staying at home, decided to produce something and opened an ornaments gift store.

With the help of the loan she is planning to buy ornaments, sell them and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Pakize hanım eşinden ayrı iki çocuk annesi. Yirmi yıl hastanelerde hemşire olarak görev yapmış ve emekli olmuş. Evde oturmaktan sıkılmış bir şeyler üretmeye karar vermiş, hediyelik eşya dükkanı açarak çalışma hayatına başlamış. Aldığı mikro kredi ile hediyelik eşya alarak satarak işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy ornaments.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Khim’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Khim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is thankful for the previous loan granted to her. It has certainly helped sustain her store and thus helped in their daily sustenance. She is glad that she was able to start a small "carinderia" (eatery) selling and serving affordable viands for the masses.

She is again humbly requesting for a PHP 30,000 loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles which she sells at retail. Part of the loan she will also use to pay for meat, veggies, seasoning and other materials need for her small "carinderia". She is glad at the good turnout of her eatery.

Annie believes her store and eatery will continue to grow and become big. She trusts God will crown her efforts with success. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell and ingredients needed at her eatery.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
Lim’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Lim makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Fedaa

texts.en:
Fedaa is a 27-year-old, married woman with two children. She lives in Dairalla. Fedaa is a holder of a primary school certificate. She could not complete her education because of the financial situation for her family; therefore, she is working hard to ‎‎provide a good education for her children. She decided to start selling a variety of products which she feels are ‎‎covering the needs of the residents of the neighborhood.‎

Fedaa stated that her business is doing well; therefore, she wants to expand her business and get more money to save for ‎her children's future. She is applying for the loan so she can get more products, such as clothes and accessories, ‎cosmetics, and kitchen supplies to sell and increase her income.‎

loans.use: to get more products, such as clothes and accessories, ‎cosmetics, and kitchen supplies to sell.

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Ten years ago, Celina started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of three children sells milk, vegetables, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. Celina is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. This makes Celina very proud. Although she makes a profit selling milk, she lacks a proper dairy unit.

Celina is requesting a loan to build a proper dairy unit. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Celina’s loan will help her to more easily milk and feed cow. She believes that her loan will change her living conditions because her milk production will increase. Celina will also save money that she used to spend on treating her cows. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin’s group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sarin makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en: Long’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Long makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as factory laborer and driver to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help these men and this woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Yab's Group

texts.en: Yab’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yab makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving the time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Davina

texts.en:
Divina is thanking KIVA and CCT for their tireless financial and moral support for her livelihood. She has received a number of loans which certainly aided a productive harvest of pine apples on her farm, thus providing income to feed her children and send them to school.

To sustain and grow her harvest, she is again seeking assistance in the amount of Php 8000 to pay for more seedlings, fertilizer and labor. Although her farm suffers when hit by typhoons, she still maintains her faith that they can make it. After the storm, the sun rises again and gives new life and renewed hope for better days.

Divina prays for a plentiful harvest continues to dream for a bigger farm and for her children to finish schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm supplies and fertilizer to ensure a productive harvest.

loans.name: Jane Rose

texts.en:
Jane Rose is 44 years old, married and has two children. One of whom is in school.

Jane Rose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jane Rose requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Jane Rose has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jane Rose would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is a 23-year-old single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a business making bricks and has a retail shop which he operates 12 hours a day, and has been working in these businesses for 3 years. He started the businesses with a hope of employing himself and eradicating poverty from his home. He is facing the challenges of unpredictable weather changes, especially heavy rains which destroy his bricks and delay them from drying. Vincent has a dream of buying land where he intends to construct a residential house for his family. He needs a loan to add more stocks of salt, sugar and cooking oil in his retail shop.

loans.use: to add more stocks of salt, sugar and cooking oil in his retail shop.

loans.name: Eglay

texts.en:
Eglay, 44 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Nangili, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married with 6 children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eleven years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. The Nangili, Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. She stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is the increased profits she enjoys. Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level.

The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a committed married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in coffee and banana growing to earn a living and support his family. He desires to develop his land  into a modern commercial farm and increase on his house hold income in order to improve on the standards of living but he is challenged by inadequate capital and loss of soil fertility leading to low yields.
Deus will use the requested loan to buy manure, mulch and fertilizers for his gardens.

loans.use: to buy manure, mulch and fertilizers for his gardens.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a housewife who is 45 years old. She looks after her family including four children. She is very hardworking in her routine work and punctual in her payments.

Rubina's husband is the sole earner for the family. He works in the preparation of laundry related items. He buys necessary raw materials from the market for the preparation of items such as laundry soaps, detergents, surfs, etc. He works hard and honestly for better earnings to support his family; he is providing better detergents and other necessary cleaning items to the laundresses as well as retailers.

Rubina wants to take loan so that her husband will be able to get more raw materials to prepare maximum and reliable laundry items. In this way, Rubina's husband will be better able to provide financial support to the family to maintain their living standards.

Rubina is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's laundry-products making business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a maize farmer from Jaki village. As a Babban Gona member, Gloria is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Gloria would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Gloria can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Gloria no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Gloria hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Savith's Group

texts.en:
Savith’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. He makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In Savith’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Savith is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is a 36-year-old married mother with five dependent children, four of whom are in school. She is a resident in Kampong Thom province. Sokha works as construction worker to make a living. 

Sokha is requesting a loan from VisionFund to pay tuition fees for her daughter. In the future, she hopes that her daughter will be able to study at university and get a good job to help support the family.

loans.use: to pay  tuition fees for her daughter

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Eai's Group

texts.en:
Eai’s group lives in a rural village in the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Eai makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In Eai’s village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Eai is requesting a loan to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, and to save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is highly blessed by Kiva and its lenders for their kind hearts and several financial supports in the past. This support has really helped her sustain and grow her variety store business and encouraged her to be more diligent. Marichu is forever grateful for your help. 

Marichu is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan to refill her store with more groceries, rice, and beverages. Once again, she trusts that you could lend her funds. Marichu will use the profit from her loan for a planned burger and fish ball restaurant as additional source of income. This is one of the innovations that she aims to do in order to stay competitive. She will also use the additional income to help cover her family’s daily household needs and the school needs of her child. Every week, Marichu meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God which she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, rice, and beverages

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en:
Ma. Regina is 40 years old and married with four children.

Ma. Regina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like canned good, soft-drinks, personal care products and other groceries.

Ma. Regina has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Ma. Regina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned good, soft-drinks, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en:
Benon is an old, hardworking widower living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He lives with a grandchild and is a farmer who mainly grows coffee which he sells to get income. His heart desires that he develops more compared to how he is now, as he looks forward to constructing a good permanent house. Benon also intends to educate his children since he is their only parent who is still alive but all his dreams have not been fulfilled because of inadequate capital and manpower to work on his gardens.

He is requesting a loan to buy mulch and manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy mulch and manure for his farm.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from Rafin Tabo village. As a Babban Gona member, Samaila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Samaila can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.
Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Samaila no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Samaila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

Mwanaisha has operated a beauty salon for the past ten years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbours and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating her hairdressing skills in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Saron's Group

texts.en: Saron’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saron makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as saving time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a 35-year-old lady who is married with 5 children. They reside in Kalerwe, a surburb of Kampala. Prossy sells charcoal and groceries at a local market near her area of residence in the city outskirts.

She is a third time borrrower and has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX for the purpose of boosting her business by buying more sacks of charcoal and matoke (green plantains) to sell. She is a good client and well disciplined. She intends to borrow more money after this loan so that she can clear the payment for her land, which is paid for partly, and also begin building a home for her children which will increase her income since she will not be paying rent anymore.

She is so grateful to the institution for the funds they provide to them as low income earners.

loans.use: to boost her charcoal trade business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She lives with her family in the town of Badian, Cebu. She has been engaged in this business for two years now. This is the source of her income. Emma is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, toothpaste, detergent, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store as well as her sales and profit. In the future, Emma hopes to make her business successful and more sustainable. The profit generated will be spent on the school fees of her three children aged four, five and six.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, toothpaste, detergent, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Samath's Group

texts.en:
Samath’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province of Cambodia.

Samath makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time needed to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chhern's Group

texts.en:
Chhern’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Chhern makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time needed to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Meral

texts.en:
Meral is single and lives alone. After her father's death she started to work and started selling women's shoes and bags. She has been doing this for six years. She has requested for loans twice. With the help of the loans she bought shoes and bags in bulk, sold them, gained money and expanded her business. With the help of the third loan she is planning to buy bags and shoes, and sell them and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Meral hanım bekar yalnız yaşıyor. Meral hanım babası vefat ettikten sonra çalışma hayatına başlıyor, kadın ayakkabı ve çanta dükkanı açıyor. Altı yıldır bu işi yapıyor. Mikro krediden iki kez faydalandı. Aldığı kredi ile dükkanına kadın ayakkabıları aldı sattı para kazandı ve işlerini geliştirdi. Üçüncü aldığı mikro kredi ile de dükkanına kadın ayakkabıları ve çantaları alarak satarak para kazanmayı ve işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy bags and shoes.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.

Pov makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time needed to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 36-year-old married mother of three who has been the owner of a grocery store since 2000. Lina started this business through supporting her father-in-law in his shop, and acquired the necessary experience in this domain. She is a hard working woman who is managing to support her husband in covering their family's living needs, and slightly developing her business.

Since Lina lives and works in a rural village, she is working hard to keep her business ready with all the products that are highly requested during the winter season. However, such a request needs to be paid in cash to the dealers so that she can benefit from special offers. This is why she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her goods (cereal, hot drinks and many others) and add new items especially winter goods.

This is an important source of livelihood for Lina’s family since she supports her husband, who works as an electrician, in their social and financial lives.

Lina works hard at developing her customer service because she believes clients are her base to depend on for future business development. She hopes to expand her business and improve its decor when she is financially capable enough to take this step forward.

loans.use: to increase her goods and add new items especially winter goods (cereal, hot drinks and many others) by taking advantage of special offers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Meet Lucy from Kerugoya, Kenya. Although she is from a community not known for farming, she is earning a living through agriculture. She is happily married, and together with her husband, is blessed with a lovely and cute family. For the past seven years, she has been practicing mixed farming, and, because of the experience she has, she commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from operating a mixed farm; and selling milk, eggs, and maize has allowed her to make a decent living. Lucy passionately loves dairy farming, and the animals on her farm have been given names. Lucy has been actively engaged in mixed farming. She sells her farm’s produce at a local market near her home. Her in-depth knowledge of her environment has enabled Lucy to get her hands on numerous small business opportunities. Lucy is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry.

She is very passionate about poultry farming. The most enjoyable task to her is raising poultry. Ironically, she doesn't enjoy feeding cows. Having additional poultry on her farm will bring her untold joy. The hens will also increase the farm's egg production, and thus, increase sales volume. Lucy needs to increase her income to take care of her family's expenses. All that Lucy waits for is your kindness.

You can be part of this dream. Be inspired and support the life of this mum with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Laulence

texts.en:
Laulence is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a farmer. He used his previous loan to buy manure to maintain his coffee plants. He is still involved in farming and that is where he earns a living although he also sells coffee and grazes goats to earn extra income. He has plans of becoming a modernized farmer, improving his household income, building a permanent house and educating his children for a better future. However, he faces the challenges of limited finance, pests and diseases.

He is requesting a loan to pay for labour for appying manure, mulch and fertilizers to attain bigger harvests.

loans.use: to pay for labour for applying manure, mulch and fertilizers to attain bigger harvests.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwatime operates a stall selling vegetables and she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, onions and two crates of tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, onions and two crates of tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sambath works as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Mairo

texts.en:
Mairo is a maize farmer from Daura village. As a Babban Gona member, Mairo is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mairo would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Mairo can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mairo no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mairo hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell her maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sreymech's Group

texts.en:
Sreymech’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymech works as factory laborer, and she also does extra work as a clerk to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Theary's Group

texts.en:
Theary’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Theary works as seller, selling cakes and groceries; she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

n their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Ley’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Narin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima an eighteen years old single lady who was supported by her father who opened for her two years ago a mobile phones selling shop, to help her rely on herself and acquire a good experience in her domain and in business precisely.
 
Fatima is well known in her region and supported by most of her neighbors, relatives and friends. She proved to be a smart businesswoman, who invests her acquired experience in developing her business as much as she can.

Fatima decided to develop her business without asking for her father’s financial support, since she believes that what he did for her to start her business is more than enough.

That’s why she decided to acquire a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new released mobile phones accessories and prepaid cards.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business in a well managed way.

loans.use: to to increase her business merchandise with new released mobile phones accessories and prepaid cards.

loans.name: Orifa

texts.ru: Орифа очень добрый и надежный человек. Она сама всего добивается. Орифа живет с дочкой, сыном и невесткой. У Орифы свой магазин, в котором она продает продукты питания. В этом деле она уже 5 лет. Во всем ей помогает ее дочь Гулчехра. В данный момент бизнес идет не очень хорошо. За счет своего бизнеса Орифа кормит свою семью. Поэтому Орифа хочет увеличить товарооборот и увеличить доход. Для этого ей необходима ваша помощь. Орифа просит Вас поддержать ее финансами.
texts.en: Orifa is a very kind and reliable person. She achieves everything on her own. Orifa lives with her daughter, son and daughter-in-law. Orifa has her own store in which she sells food goods. She has been in this business for five years. Her daughter Gulchehra helps her with everything. At the present time the business is not going very well. Orifa feeds her family from the business, and so Orifa wants to increase her stock of goods and increase her income. Your help is essential to her for this. Orifa is asking you to support her with financing.

loans.use: to increase the stock of goods in her food store.

loans.name: Farrukhjon

texts.en:
Farrukhjon was born in 1995. He is single and he lives with parents in a rural area. Since childhood, Farrukhjon has helped his parents in growing vegetables and feeding cattle. Farrukhjon has a great experience in this field. Also, he is clever.

Farrukhjon is a student in the second year. He studies well and he always tries to get new and useful information for himself. Now, his father is a migrant in Russia and he doesn’t send money.

Farrukhjon is asking for a loan to pay for the university tuition. He is a repeat client of IMON and he is a very responsible client.

He awaits the generosity of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To pay for the university tuition

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is single and 25 years old. She live in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental with her parents and siblings, Jennifer rent and manage a food stall in the market, she help her parents in their family needs. She cooks from a menu and sale. She wants to earn a higher income and be able to help her parents pay for their maintenance medication, so she decided to purchase additional raw ingredients to generate more income. Jennifer plans in the future to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to cook.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en: Ronald is a single man living in Fort Portal Uganda, he has a business of retail dealing in the sale of spare parts which he has been doing for one and a half years. He was inspired by his father who was also doing the same business. He started his business with capital of 200,000= , and he kept growing slowly by slowly.
