He is charged with the responsibility of paying school fees for his young brother. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital hindering him from expanding his business to new areas. However, he has future prospects of buying land where he can construct rentals as a way of increasing his daily income. Ronald has asked for a loan to help him buy more spare parts for selling.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for selling

loans.name: Yasemin

texts.en:
Yasemin is married and a mother of three. She started to work because her husband's salary was not enough. For long years she has worked as a masseuse in massage salons. She attended many courses on mesotherapy (non-surgical cosmetic medicine treatment) and now she is doing massage at home. She says that her job enables her development. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy massage oils and some other materials. She wants to develop herself in massage and mesotherapy and to open a place of her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Yasemin hanım evli üç çocuk annesi. Eşinin maaşı yeterli gelmediği için çalışmaya başlıyor. Uzun yıllar masaj salonlarında masöz olarak çalışmış. Çalışırken birçok kurslara katılmış mezoterapi konularında eğitimler almış ve şimdi evde mezoterapi, kuru ve ıslak kupa çekme, masaj yaparak çalışma hayatına devam ediyor. Yaptığı işin sürekli kendisini geliştirmek olduğunu söylüyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile masaj yağları ve kupalar alacak. Masajlar ve mezoterapi yaparak işlerini geliştirmek ve iş yeri açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy massage oils and other materials for her massage business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old, married with five children. One of whom is in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Mary has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Mary has been in this business for three years. In the future, Mary would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rumdeng's Group

texts.en:
Rumdeng’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rumdeng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and this man safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bibisora

texts.ru: Бибисора женщина с большим опытом работы в сфере шитья. Ей 37 лет. Она в разводе и сама воспитывает своих детей. Но, не смотря на трудные жизненные условия, у Бибисора есть любимое дело, которое позволяет ей обеспечивать свою семью. У нее много постоянных клиенток, которые очень довольны качеством ее дела. Бибисора хочет предоставить своим клиенткам несколько вариантов своих моделей платьев. Однако для этого ей необходимо приобрести несколько видов тканей.  Она обратилась к вам с верой на ваше понимание.
texts.en: Bibisora is a woman with great work experience in the field of sewing. She is 37 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children on her won. But, despite her difficult living conditions, Bibisora has a beloved occupation that enables her to provide for her family. She has many regular clients who are very satisfied with the quality of her work. Bibisora wants to offer a few variations of her dress designs to her clients. However, to do this she needs to buy a few types of fabric. She has turned to you with hope in your understanding.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for her sewing business.

loans.name: Dayanat

texts.en:
Dayanat is 23 years old, single and lives with his parents. Dayanat’s mother is a housewife, and his father is a pensioner. The family lives in the Mahmudlu village of the Fuzuli region. Dayanat is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. He is engaged, and in the near future, wants to get married.

Dayanat has been in the agriculture business for two years. Now he needs a loan in the amount of 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this amount, he is planning to buy more wheat, barley, corn, alfalfa, etc., for reselling etc to expand his business.

Dayanat is thankful for the help from Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more wheat, barley, corn, alfalfa, etc., for reselling.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Emmanuel would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Emmanuel will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Emmanuel now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Shereen

texts.en:
Shereen is 24 years old and is an example of an ambitious, willpowered and hard working lady. She lives in Dairalla and she ‎attends to a very simple family. She wants to help them to improve the standard of living for her family. She is very ‎responsible lady and she left her university to work and help her father. ‎

Shereen did not find a job that suited her conservative family, therefore she decided to sell blankets in her home. She applied for a loan to buy more blankets to sell and increase her income. She hopes in the future to complete her ‎education and find good job so that she will be able help her family more and more.‎

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell and increase her income.

loans.name: Kozeta

texts.en:
Kozeta is 45 years old and married, and has been doing wholesale these past three yeas to earn a living. She has set up a little booth in the farmer's market in the little town of approximately 10000 inhabitants where she lives, and now wants to invest in a vehicle with a large enough trunk where she can store the fresh produce.

"I need a place where I can hold my produce because I don't have a place where to keep them. I live in an apartment building. Had I owned a house, I would definitely find some space to keep the produce there. So, the vehicle that i want to buy would be both, a storage and a vehicle," said Kozeta when she explained the reason for the loan to the loan officer.

Her husband has been helping her with the transportation of the produce, however lately he cannot do that anymore due to the fact that his working hours have changed. He owns a people-transportation vehicle and has been working for some passenger's company for a pay of $233/month.

loans.use: to invest in a vehicle with a large trunk to act both as a storage for her produce and to transport the produce.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 40s, is single with two grown-up kids. She has been selling fabrics and sarongs for nine years now. She works from 8 am to 2 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her clothing stocks and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to repay the loan, to take care of her family including grandchildren and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase stocks and to buy the best selling fabrics and sarongs to meet her customers’ requirements. She dreams of becoming an international business woman.

Mariam will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling fabrics and sarongs to meet her customers’ requirements.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a hard-working, 53-year-old married mother of one child. She has been working in a catering business from her house for one year.

Randa is passionate about cooking, thus her newly established business isn't hard for her to develop and compete with others with the good tastes. She has to set good marketing plans to expand her working sector, but first of all she has to proceed in buying the necessary equipment related to a certain set plan.

Her business income is just fine to cover her family's living needs in parallel with her husband's, but she can't currently rely on it to develop her business widely. Thus an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help her to develop her business through buying a special Saj bread oven and dough, requested raw materials, machines and other needs.

Randa is running her business from her house, she will work hard to move it to a better wider place in the future, when she finds that her business income can cover these increasing business development needs.

loans.use: to develop her business through buying a special Saj bread oven and dough, requested raw materials, machines and other needs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a businesswoman from Badian, Cebu. She owns a Sari-sari store which she has been involved with for a year now.  She has two children aged eight and sixteen. She is requesting a loan to purchase additional merchandise like canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee, shampoo, chips, seasoning and sugar. In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business to invest in other ventures and at the same time to provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, toiletries, coffee, shampoo, chips, seasoning and sugar.

loans.name: Talatu

texts.en:
Talatu is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Talatu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Talatu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Talatu can to store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Talatu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Talatu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.es:
Filiberto es un hombre de 59 años de edad es casado con una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre 16 y 35 años, esta humilde familia vive en  una comunidad de Sololá.
Filiberto para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica al cultivo, sembrando una variedad de verduras, el lleva 20 años de realizar esta actividad.
Filiberto esta busca un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de cebollas, pues la época de lluvia ya se está alejando y esta verdura es buena para la época de verano.
El espera incrementar su cultivo con esta inversión y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Filiberto is a 59-year-old man who is married with a lovely family of eight children, ages 16 to 35. This humble family lives in a community in Solola.

To obtain income and advance his family, Filiberto dedicates his efforts to farming, sowing a variety of vegetables. He has pursued this activity for the last 20 years.

Filiberto is seeking a loan to cover the purchase of agricultural inputs required for cultivating onions. The rainy season is now coming to an end and this is a good vegetable for summer cultivation.

He hopes to increase his crop with the new investment and, as a result, to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase agricultural inputs needed for cultivating onions.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
Kea’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kea makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Nivo Arisata

texts.fr:
Nivo a 34 ans, elle est divorcée. Elle a 4 enfants (12-10-8-3 ans) qui vivent auprès de leur grand-mère dans une autre région. 
Elle vend des arachides (achat et revente) et des arachides transformées (cuites et mises en sachet) et des cacahuètes. Elle a une année d’expérience dans la vente d’arachide . Avant, elle vendait des bananes mais elle a arrêté en raison d’un problème auprès du fournisseur. C’est une activité héritée de ses parents. Elle a toujours cherché les moyens pour développer l’activité, elle est actuellement à son cinquième prêt : augmentation de stock et diversification d’activités et .
Elle vit dans une maison louée avec sa tante. Elle projette de construire une maison et diversifier les produits vendus: fruits.
texts.en:
Nivo is 34-years-old. She is divorced. She has four children (12-, 10-, 8- and 3-years-old) who live near their grandmother in another region.

She sells peanuts (purchases and resells) and processed peanuts (cooked and bagged) and peanut butter. She has one year of experience selling peanuts. Previously, she sold bananas but she stopped due to a problem with the supplier. This is a business she took over from her relatives. She was always looking for ways to grow the business. She is currently on her fifth loan: to grow the stock and diversify the business and [sic].

She lives in a house she rents with her aunt. She intends to build a house and diversify the products she sells: fruit.

loans.use: to buy peanuts

loans.name: Angelica Marina

texts.es:
Angélica es una mujer de 37 años de edad es casada vive junto a su esposo y familiares en una comunidad de Sololá.
Angélica con el afán de obtener sus ingresos desde hace 5 años decidió buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos por esa razón es comerciante en su mercado regional.
Angélica en estos momentos tiene la necesidad junto a su familia de cambiar su vehículo, pues ellos viven en una zona muy lejana de su comunidad y este vehículo por años los ha movilizado de un lugar a otro, aunque por mucho tiempo ha buscado la manera de poder cambiar su vehículo no le ha sido posible por esa razón solicita un préstamo para poder cambiarlo al fin. Su gran sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Angelica is a 37-year-old woman who is married and lives with her husband and family in a community in Solola.

After proudly earning her own income for the last five years, Angelica decided to seek an activity that would generate greater income. For this reason, she has become a merchant in her regional market.

Now, Angelica and her family need to exchange their old vehicle. They reside in a zone some distance from the community market and their present vehicle, which has transported them from one place to another for a long time, needs replacing. Angelica has sought to exchange vehicles, but it has not been possible. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order, finally, to exchange their vehicle.

Angelica's grand dream is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a more reliable vehicle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is grateful that she has on a number of times received loans and promptly repaid all of those loans. It definitely helped fund maintenance of her jeepney. It ensured safe and efficient service thus continuous income to meet her family's needs

She trusts that she can again request a 15,000 PHP loan to pay for the battery, seat cover and fuel of her jeepney service. It is important that her transportation business will continue to adequately provide for their daily needs and fund the education of her children. She is thanking God for faithfully supporting her livelihood.

Eva hopes to acquire another jeepney to improve her income to be able to give her children a college eduation and allow them a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the regular maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Bircan

texts.en:
Bircan is married and has two children. In order to make a contribution to the family budget, she is making mantı (Turkish dumplings) and dolma (stuffed vine leaves) at home and selling them to her neighbours. With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy bulks of flour, butter, leaves and meat, make mantı and dolma, sell them and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Bircan hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Bircan hanım aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için evde mantı ve yaprak sarma yaparak yakınlarına ve çevresine satış yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile un, yağ, yaprak ve kıymayı toptan alarak üreterek satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, vine leaves and meat.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Mathew has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Mathew can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Mathew will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Mathew is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Wanaume Ni Kazi Group

texts.fr: Gilbert sollicite un deuxième crédit qui sera orienté comme le précédent dans le labour, sarclage, achat des engrais et des produits phytosanitaires. Avec le gain qu'il a réalisé de cent cinquante dollars, après déduction des charges d'exploitation, il les a utilisé dans la scolarisation des enfants, l'alimentation, les soins médicaux et l'élargissement de son activité. L'insuffisance d'eau d'irrigation et le rabais du prix sont des éléments qui ont retardé son remboursement. Toutefois, il souhaite élargir son espace cultural et accroitre sa production
texts.en: Gilbert is requesting a second loan which will, as was the case for his first loan, be used to pay for labor, hoeing, the purchase of fertilizer and phytosanitary products. With the profit of 150 dollars that he made - after operating expenses - he has paid for his children's schooling, food, healthcare and the expansion of his business. The lack of water for irrigation purposes and the cut in prices are factors which have delayed his loan repayment. He would, however, like to expand his farming land and increase his production.

loans.use: to pay for labor, hoeing, transplanting, the purchase of fertilizer and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use part of the loan to buy stock of cabbages, kales, tomatoes, onions, avocados, bananas for selling and the other part to expand her house.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay college fee for her child. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of cabbages, kales, tomatoes, onions, avocadoes, bananas for selling and the other part to expand her house.

loans.name: Catheline

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Catheline (pictured above) from the Muichiune, Nkubu area of Kenya, an area that is very fertile. Catheline is 46 years old and a proud mother of angelic-looking children whom she really adores and cherishes. In addition to doing some small business, Catheline is a very hardworking farmer. She has been farming for the past five years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Catheline practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and also keeps dairy cows. Through these activities she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed one of her cows. She really enjoys taking care of her cows. 

Although Catheline has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest lately because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds, and the presence of pests and diseases. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy farm implements and seeds, so as to expand her horticulture farm. Through the loan, Catheline will be assured of a bumper harvest and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, she will increase her profit margins. Using this loan, Catheline will be able to expand her horticulture business. She sees a lot of room for improvement and growth. What is lacking is the capital to drive the positive change. With your loan, Catheline will make enough income to take care of her family and other farming expenses.

She wakes up early and goes to sleep very late every day to give her family a decent living and afford her children proper education. You can help Catheline with this dream with a loan; that would mean a lot to her and her family.

loans.use: to buy farm implements and seeds to expand her horticulture farm.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten is 30 years old and lives in Dairalla. She is the mother of five children who are in school. 

Faten has had beauty talent since ‎childhood. Because her husband is working with a low income and she wants to help him, she decided to use this ‎talent to start her own business.‎ She opened her beauty salon in her house and also sells accessories, cosmetics, and clothes. 

Because of the high demands ‎of life, she wants to expand her business has applied for a loan. She will use the money to purchase shampoo, hair conditioners, nail polish, and polish remover. She will use the ‎anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and save the rest of money. 

Faten hopes that she has an independent ‎beauty salon and wants to be financially stable in the future.‎

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and home products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a repeat client of Ugafode Micro finance. She is aged 28 years and is married. She has two children. She owns a retail shop in a local market near her residence.

She has taken a loan of UGX 1,000,000 for the purpose of restocking her shop. She is a good client and also God-fearing. She hopes to borrow more money in order to upgrade her retail shop into a whole sale shop.

She is so grateful for the funds. Since she started borrowing, she has been able to increase her sales, hence improving her status.

loans.use: To buy goods for her shop.

loans.name: Cemile

texts.en:
Cemile is divorced and a mother of three. She has to work because they have financial problems. She is making manti (Turkish dumplings) and beetroot juice on the season. With three previous loans she bought manti ingredients, made manti and sold them. She also made beetroot juice and sold them and made money. She is planning to buy beetroot on the season, make beetroot juice, sell them, make money and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Cemile hanım üç çocuk annesi eşinden ayrı. Aile ekonomisi zorda olduğu için çalışmak durumunda. Mantı yapıyor, pancar sezonunda pancar pekmezi yapıyor. Üç kez mikro kredi kullandı mantı malzemeleri aldı üretti sattı ve para kazandı. Pancar dan pekmez üretti ve sattı para kazandı. Sezon olarak pancar mevsimi pancar alarak ve pekmez üreterek para kazanmak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy beetroot.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer from Lado village. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Saratu can to store the maize she harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saratu no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Saratu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 35 year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop which he has been running for four years now. He started on a small scale and was inspired by his fellow businessmen around him. He had a vision of raising more income for his family. He is facing a hardship of inadequate capital. That hinders him from expanding his business.

However, he is looking at completing construction of his residential house and improving the standard of living for his family. Francis has asked for a loan to help him buy doors and windows for his house construction.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for his house construction.

loans.name: Theruya

texts.en:
Theruya is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family .

She operates a business of selling water from her house in a retail shop, selling to the neighbours. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase a stock of water for resale .She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of water for resale .

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married mother of one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years she has operated a business selling clothes, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the requested loan of 30,000 Kes. she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 55-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore. Her son is a wholesaler of rice. He buys the rice from harvesters at a low price and sells in Lahore city to the retailers. He buys rice of various kinds such as basmati, super kernel, etc. He has been doing the same practice for many years and has many retailers who like to buy rice from him in large quantity. He has built up positive relationships among the retailers. His customers come because of his advertisement as well. With the increase in new customers and demand, he wants to buy rice in bulk, so that he can easily cope with the rapid increase in demand.


Therefore, Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy various kinds of rice. In this way, he will be able to increase his monthly income and savings and can cherish his own children and siblings as well.

Kousar praises supporters, and she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of various kinds of rice for her son's rice wholesale business.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a milk seller by profession. She sells milk in her community. She has been selling milk along with her husband for many years. Her husband sells milk in a nearby town and she sells in the neighborhood. In this way, both are contributing to household expenses.

Shaheen is 45 years old, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Day by day, the needs of her family are increasing but her source of income is still constant. Therefore, Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can grow her cattle for producing more milk. Through the loan amount she will buy a cow with the contribution of savings.
Shaheen thanks Kiva and field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow for increasing her milk production and sales.

loans.name: Daysi Marilu

texts.es:
Deysi, se mantiene trabajando en el campo por lo que solicita un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar herbicidas, insecticidas y abono con estos materiales dará mantenimiento al cultivo de dos manzanas de maíz, tiene fe de sacar una cosecha abundante y seguir dándole el sustento diario a su familia.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo cultivar maíz y pipían, también comenta que sigue vendiendo verduras para tener ingresos estables, en la actualidad su situación financiera ha mejorado, su familia permanece unida y no ha tenido dificultades de ninguna índole para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Deysi continues to work in the fields and she is requesting a new loan which she will use to buy herbicide, insecticide and manure to use to maintain her two manzana (about 3.5 acres) crop of corn. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and continue to provide daily sustenance for her family.

With the last loan she was able to grow corn and squash and she also comments that she continues to sell vegetables to have stable income. At present her financial situation has improved, her family remains together and she has had no problems continuing to work.

loans.use: to buy herbicide, insecticide and manure to maintain her two manzanas (3.5 acres) of corn crops.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land -- 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is 54 years old, married and the mother of five children, the youngest of whom is still in school. Her spouse works in construction while one of her children offers motorcycle transport services. Together, they all work hard to improve their lives. Magdalena is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to expand her food business and maintain the family's motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to improve the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour and biscuits to sell and also maintain her motorcycle.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick’s (pictured above with one of his sons) desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite his age (40) and the obstacles he has experienced, he doesn't reduce his efforts to achieve his objective - what he sets out for, he gets. He is so humble and honest and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth.

Fredrick is a father of three lovely children that he really adores so much, and he will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. He hails from the Nkubu area of Kenya. He never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job, but this did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life.

Fredrick started farming and has been doing farming for the past ten years. Through those years, he has gathered so much experience that all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. Fredrick practices mixed farming on his farm, and through the profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs and also give his children a good education because he believes that education is the key to success.

Fredrick is a farmer who is very enterprising and he is seeking a loan of 75,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on his farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products, Fredrick wants to take advantage of those factors and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Fredrick to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Fredrick hopes that, through the loan, he will improve his living conditions. Fredrick’s dreams and projections are that, by the end of the first year, he will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables.

Through this he will be able to assure his children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because he will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Fredrick is not a selfish man and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why he will employ people to work for him on his horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

Help this smallholder farmer with dreams and goals to realize! Come on – make a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a merchant from the rural town of Batuan, Bohol. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store selling commodities such as cooking oil, sugar, coffee, seasonings, soft drinks, canned goods, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.

She has two children and one of them is still in the elementary years. Her partner in life is a farmer.

To be able to cope with demands, she decided to join Kiva's field parter CEVI, to invest in canned goods, drinks and other groceries. These will fill her store and continue to provide for the needs of her family. In that way, it enables her to improve her earnings and start to expand her business.

For the future, Teresita is looking forward to becoming successful in the years to come.

loans.use: to invest in canned goods, drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Anisenta

texts.en:
Agriculture is fundamental to Kenya's economy. But it is much more than an economic activity. Farmers like Anisenta, 55, are stewards of Kenya’s countryside and provide its citizens with the option of buying locally-produced food.

Anisenta started farming in 2007 after the country suffered post-election violence. With the unstinting support of her parents, who dedicated their farm, she has grown the business dramatically. She has acquired numerous income-generating assets, including farm machines, to help her in running the farm. She keeps animals and grows subsistence and commercial crops, such as bananas. She takes pride in being independent and being involved in a sector that feeds the population.

Anisenta is seeking a loan to purchase banana seeds. Customer demand for banana is growing consistently. With your funding, Anisenta will satisfy the demand for bananas.

The money earned from the investment will be ploughed back into the business, to finance even more growth. The additional income will also enable her to repay the loan and buy food for her family.

She feels blessed to have the support of her family through all her undertakings. Make a $25 loan, and push Anisenta's dream closer to reality.

loans.use: to buy banana seeds.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a simple worker who lives in the remote village of Kathegeri, Chuka, but has a life full of dreams, hopes and best wishes for her family. She has been in the farming business for 10 years! She makes a living farming and selling her produce, which includes milk, eggs, and crops at the local market. She also does some side hustle businesses for extra income. 

Mercy spends most of her time pasturing her cows. Currently, though, she is facing a big challenge of transporting feed from the store to the animal shed. 
Today, Mercy is seeking a loan to purchase seeds. Farm supplies are increasingly becoming expensive by the day. Farmers who seek cheaper sources end up buying "fake" seeds that either do not germinate or do not produce quality seeds. With your loan, Mercy can afford seeds for planting from recommended sources to ensure her crops grow healthy and productive. 

Profits made from this harvest will be reinvested into the business for growth. 

Kindly make a loan to this hardworking Kenyan woman!

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, 41 years of age, is a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Kibugua, a remote village in Chuka. She is happily married and is blessed with three children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. The Chuka area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the best part is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES to buy poultry.

Because she is a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate into increased profit margins and an improved income level.

Being a visionary woman, Mary intends to accumulate more profits. The extra income she will earn will be used in fully repaying the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Faith, 29 years of age and a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Mukuuni, a remote village in Chuka. She is happily married and blessed with three adorable children.

Faith has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaged in other small personal businesses (timber cutting and welding).

The Chuka area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she states that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.”

Faith's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 60,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market; this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry sales to other markets as this will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

The extra income Faith will earn will be used to fully repay the loan and permanently change her living conditions to secure the future of her school-aged children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past seven years she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the 30,000 Kes. loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a 49-year-old farmer. She is an extraordinary woman with a great personality. She is a role model, a mentor, and an inspiration to many young farmers in her village because of her resilience despite personal challenges, and her passion to support her children as a primary caregiver.

For the past five years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been growing maize, cabbage, and tomatoes and keeping dairy cows. Aileen has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. After she lost her formal job, the role of primary caregiver of the family has been overwhelming because of the responsibility of feeding the whole family. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family," she said.

Aileen is requesting a loan to buy an additional quality dairy cow and to build a modern dairy unit. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10 and 20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to more profits and increased income levels. The profit from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise.

Aileen is very visionary, and in the near future, she intends to start adding value to her milk business by packaging the milk before selling it. She will also start selling dairy products such as yoghurt. An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Aileen believes that if women smallholder farmers had the same access to resources as large scale farmers, the number of people dying because of hunger could be reduced.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow and build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Rebeca Lissette

texts.es:
Rebeca, está acompañada y ya tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, vive junto a su familia, ella desarrolla la actividad de cosmetología para tener recursos económicos con los que cubre necesidades básicas de su familia, ella trabaja de martes a domingo con horarios de diez de la mañana a seis de la tarde y su mayor ventaja es que en la zona no existe mucha competencia.
Para Rebeca es importante contar con clientes satisfechos y está solicitando un crédito para lograrlo, lo utilizara para comprar una silla especial para realizar cortes de cabello, además adquirirá shampoos, tintes, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros productos de belleza que sean necesarios para tener un negocio bien surtido, espera tener oportunidad de mejorar el  servicio a sus clientes e incrementar así sus ganancias.
Persigue el sueño de compartir con su familia un mejor estilo de vida y tener una sala de belleza mejor establecida.
texts.en:
Rebeca is in a relationship and has a two year old son. She lives with her family. She works in the cosmetology business in order to obtain economic resources to cover the basic needs of her family. She works from Tuesday to Sunday from 10 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Her main advantage is the lack of competition in her area.

It is important for Rebeca to have satisfied clients and she is requesting a loan to achieve this. She will use it to buy a specialized chair for cutting hair and also acquire shampoo, dye, creams and cosmetics amongst other beauty products which are necessary to have a well stocked business. She hopes to have the opportunity to improve the service to her customers and thereby increase her profits.

She continues to pursue the dream of sharing a better style of living with her family and have a better established beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy a specialized chair for cutting hair and also acquire shampoo, dye, creams and cosmetics amongst other beauty products.

loans.name: Idania Del Socorro

texts.es: Idania es una mujer emprendedora que ha logrado salir adelante en el negocio de elaboración y venta de pan, su papa fue quien le heredo esta profesión, su familia es su principal apoyo. Actualmente vende productos en los diferentes barrios de la capital y le gustaría distribuir sus productos en los diferentes supermercados del país. Idania está agradecida con el préstamo que se le otorgó anteriormente es por esta razón que solicita un crédito para comprar materia prima tales como harina, manteca, azúcar y levadura. Con este crédito podrá tener mayor producción y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, también su panadería podrá ser fuente de empleo y de ingresos para su comunidad. Dentro de sus metas próximas esta componer el horno con el que trabaja actualmente y comprar dos hornos más para incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Idania is an enterprising woman who has managed to get ahead with her business making and selling bread.  She learned this profession from her father, and her family is her main support.  She now sells products in the various neighborhoods of the capital city, and she would like to distribute her products to the various supermarkets in her country.  

Idania is grateful for the loan that she took previously, and this is why she is requesting another loan to buy raw materials such as flour, butter, sugar, and yeast.  With this loan, she will be able to increase her production and meet the demands of her customers.  Also, her bakery will become a source of employment and income for the community.  Her near term goals include repairing the oven that she currently uses in her business, and buying 2 more ovens to increase her production.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Aashi

texts.en: Aashi is 32 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide a better life to her children, but needs to have a good source of income to do this. Her husband has been driving a motorized rickshaw for several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family, and he has to maintain the rickshaw’s body. Aashi is requesting this loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to allow her husband to buy a new body for his vehicle. She thanks Kiva lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy a motorized rickshaw's body for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is a 35 year old man and a loving husband and father of 2 young children. He makes a living by crafting taxi attachments, in a workshop he owns. There he makes signs or taximeters. He likes his job because is enough to provide for his family and because he has been in that line of work for a long time.

Ernesto knows his business perfectly, it was once his father's and he started to work there by helping his father since he was 15 years old, so later he would inherit the business. Ernesto is a hard worker, everything he does, he does for his children, to see them move forward. Ernesto wants to invest in some materials to keep crafting the taxi attachments,so he is applying for a 12,000 MXN loan.

He has a good credit history and, according to his references, he is a very responsible person who pays his debts on time.

loans.use: to invest in his taxi sign-making business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA QUE NO ESCUCHA BIEN, NECESITA QUE LAS PERSONAS LE GRITEN Y ESTO  LE DA VERGUENZA, SUFRE DE  UNA SEVERA PERDIDA AUDITIVA POR LO QUE LE URGE UN APARATO, DESAFORTUNADAMENTE NO CUENTA CON EL DINERO SUFICIENTE PARA ADQUIRIRLO Y ASI PODER RECUPERAR SU SENTIDO AUDITIVO.
texts.en: This borrower cannot hear well.  It is necessary for people to shout for her to hear, and this embarrasses her.  She suffers from severe hearing loss, and so they have urged her to get a hearing aid.  Unfortunately, she lacks the money to acquire a hearing aid, which would help her to recover her sense of hearing.

loans.use: to pay for a hearing aid

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: zoila de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de joyeria desde hace 5 años y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso ceramico y pintando la casa, pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de pinturas, ceramica, cemento y pago de mano de obra y asi poder tener una vivienda mas limpia y ordenada.
texts.en:
48-year-old Zoila lives in her own home with her life partner and her child. She has earned a living selling jewelry for 5 years. She manages to settle some household expenses with what she earns from her sales.

She wants to improve her home by laying a ceramic floor and painting the house, but she does not have enough capital. She is requesting a loan for purchasing paints, ceramic tiles, and cement, and to pay laborers, thus being able to have a cleaner, more tidy home.

loans.use: to buy paints, ceramic, and cement, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: San Antonio-73 Group

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 55 años de edad, vive con su parea, tiene un hijo de 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, amable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger a los sobrevivientes de la riada años atrás, actualmente convertida en el brazo pujante de manufactura y comercio en general.
Ana es de tez morena, baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general (la primera de la derecha, viste blusa fucsia y calza naranja). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. el deseo por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de personas. Su negocio es la venta de comida como: las ‘Kjaras’ que es un plato típico que contiene mote, papas, chuletas de cerdo, y el cuero de cerdo que está cocido sobre las brasas vivas, ‘este plato ha sido estilizado con ingredientes nuevos, porque el original solo lleva cuero de cerdo...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de insumos de cocina como; carne, mote, papas, carbón y otros. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta amplio y más clientes, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina y mesas y sillas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ana solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina y muebles para su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Ana is a 55-year-old woman who lives with her husband. She has a 15-year-old son, and her business is selling food.

She is enterprising, friendly and very hard-working. She operates her business in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood, which is known for welcoming the survivors of the flood several years ago. Today it has become a dynamic center for manufacturing and trade in general. Ana has brown skin, short stature and a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family, and she also speaks Spanish due to the general culture. She is in front on the right, wearing a fuchsia blouse and orange shorts. She shares her life with her husband, who works in construction, and with her son who attends school. They live in a rented room built of brick which has drinking water, sewer and electrical connections. The desire to improve her business led her to become the leader of the communal bank. Her business is selling food such as ‘Kjaras,’ a traditional dish containing corn, potatoes, pork cutlets and pork skin cooked over an open flame. "This dish has been 'stylized' with new ingredients, since the original only contains pork skin," she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales. The disadvantage is the lack of ingredients for cooking, such as meat, corn, potatoes, charcoal and others. Her dream is to have a large sales stand and more customers. She wants to buy supplies for cooking, along with tables and chairs. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the six years she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Ana is requesting a loan to buy cooking supplies along with furniture for her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies and furniture for her sales stand.

loans.name: 10 De Abril Group

texts.es:
Magaly es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 años y su negocio es la tienda de barrio. 
Ella es emprendedora, luchadora y muy independiente. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘el torno’ área rural caracterizada por acopiar la producción agrícola del lugar.
Magaly es de tez morena, cabello negro azabache largo y baja estatura (de pie, la segunda de la derecha, viste chompa marrón y polera celeste). Su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Las ganas de mejorar su negocio la llevaron a formar una banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los socios son; venta de fruta, venta de huevo, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de ganado, venta de semillas, venta de lácteos y venta de refrescos. Su negocio es la tienda de barrio donde vende alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como, jabón, aceite, pan, fideo, arroz, papel, y otros, “la necesidad de mis vecinos me hiso iniciar mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital para surtir y abastecer la tienda. Su sueño es consolidar su negocio y estabilizarlo, ella desea comprar alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Magaly solicita un préstamo para comprar jabón, aceite, pan, fideo, arroz, papel, y otros artículos para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Magaly is a 28 year old woman. She lives with her partner and has an 8 year old son. Her business is the neighborhood store.

She is enterprising, determined, and very independent. She runs her business in "El Torno," a rural area that is known for collecting the agricultural production of the area.

Magaly is of short stature with a dark complexion and long, jet-black hair (standing, the second one on the right wearing a brown sweater and a light-blue shirt). Her native tongue is Guaraní, which is spoken in the area, and she speaks Spanish within the general culture and for the business that she runs. The drive to improve her business pushed her to form an entrepreneurship bank. The member's businesses are: selling fruit, selling eggs, selling second-hand clothing, selling natural health products, selling cattle, selling seed, selling dairy products, and selling refreshments.

Her business is the neighborhood store where she sells food and basic products such as soap, oil, bread, noodles, rice, paper, etc. "The needs of my neighbors pushed me to start my business..." she tells us. The advantage of her business is that she doesn't have competition in the area. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock and supply her store.

Her dream is to strengthen and stabilize her business. She intends to buy food and basic products to supply her store. This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the two years that she has been running her business.

For these reasons, Magaly is applying for a loan to buy soap, oil, bread, noodles, rice, paper, and other products to supply her store.

loans.use: to buy soap, oil, bread, noodles, rice, paper, and other products to supply her store.

loans.name: Judy Ann

texts.en:
Judy Ann is grateful to Kiva and CCT (Center for Community Transformation) for their continued support. They have greatly improved the quality of her life with help to her work as a "buko" (or coconut) dealer. Buko and its juice are refreshing and enjoyed by local people and foreigners. To have an adequate supply to sell, Judy Ann is requesting a loan for PHO 20,000 to buy more buko from farmers. In time, she also aims to acquire a delivery truck to transport coconut from the farm. She prays for God to reward her hard work with success and abundance and faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay loans.

loans.use: To buy sacks of coconut to sell.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucía, es propietaria de una tienda en la que abastece a sus clientes de productos de la canasta básica, el negocio lo aprendió con apoyo de sus familiares y lo está practicando desde hace 10 años; ella vive con sus familia, tiene dos personas que dependen directamente de  ella.
El financiamiento le permitirá realizar la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sal, bebidas, café, etc., para tener en su inventario los productos que sus clientes necesitan, espera saber administrar el capital para tener mejores ventas e ingresos estables, con los que tendrá la facilidad de ir cancelando sus cuotas.
Lucía aspira tener un negocio mucho más grande y así darles a sus seres queridos mejores circunstancias de vida.
texts.en:
Lucia owns a store where she supplies her customers with basic consumer goods.  She learned this business from a relative, and has been managing the store for 10 years.  She lives with her family, and she has 2 dependents.

This loan will enable her to buy rice, beans, sugar, salt, drinks, coffee, and other goods.  This way she will have the products in her inventory that her customers need.  She expects that she can manage this capital to generate more sales so that she can have a more stable income.  This will make it easy for her to make the payments on the loan.  

Lucia aspires to have a much bigger business.  This way she could give her loved ones a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda resides in the lush hills of Nandihills, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. As the key breadwinner of her family she has been practicing mixed farming for the past 5 years. Because of the immense knowledge she has of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Her primary source of income have been milk, eggs, and crops. Although she has been making profits from farming, she has identified a market for selling cereals; the only big challenge she faces is lack of funds. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cereals. She intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, beans, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and she plans to take advantage of that. 

Because of the good relationship she has with her neighbors, she plans to increase her market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets. You can help this woman achieve her dreams with this loan, which will surely bring big profits.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina tiene un hijo y es la única persona que vive con ella, al tener la responsabilidad de cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar, tuvo que fundar su negocio propio hace aproximadamente cuatro años y consiste en vender pupusas y granos básicos, la venta de pupusas la hace todos los días de cuatro de la tarde en adelante, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su residencia.
Para fortalecer más su negocio está solicitando capital prestado con el que ya tiene planeado comprar maíz, frijoles, aceite, gas propano, bebidas y arroz, piensa que así abastecerá lo suficiente su negocio para trabajar y tener ingresos.
Los objetivos de Reina son resarcir con puntualidad la deuda y trabajar muy duro para que su hijo tenga un apoyo para que siga estudiando.
texts.en:
Reina has a son who is the only person who lives with her. Having the responsibility to cover all the basic necessities of her household she had to start her business about two years ago. It consists of selling pupusas and basic grains. Her pupusa sales are every day from four in the afternoon onward and her business is located in her residence.

In order to strengthen her business more she is requesting capital which she has already planned to buy corn, beans, oil, propane, drinks and rice, thinking that will stock her business sufficiently to work and have income.

Reina's objectives are to repay her loan on time and work very hard so that her son has the support to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, oil, propane, drinks and rice, thinking that will stock her business sufficiently to work.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a marvelous and good-hearted young woman who makes her living by practicing mixed farming in the Kitale area of Kenya. She also raises cows and poultry to sell their milk and eggs. She is ambitious and full of hope for the future, and when not working is very concerned about the health of the environment. Emily is seeking a KES 20,000 loan to buy farm implements because these tools will make the work on her farm go much faster and easier — especially the digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools in the market that are handy for a woman in her line of work, but this equipment does not come cheap. The increase in income from this investment will go to her family's welfare and her children's education. She is very grateful to the people who support her project.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Ahmadaly

texts.en: Ahmadaly lives with his family in a rural area of North Tajikistan. He is a very hardworking and industrious man who always tries to improve the well-being of his family. Fifteen years ago he went into the field of animal husbandry, raising mainly cows. He buys and raises these cows, houses and feeds them in a cowshed near his house, and sells their milk and milk products to local people. Ahmadaly would like  to increase the number of cattle he has, and is requesting this loan for 10,000 Somoni to make this possible..

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Elsy Yessenia

texts.es:
Elsy, está muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado a través del crédito anterior, pues así ha fortalecido su negocio, en la actualidad comenta que tiene como actividades económicas la venta de comida rápida y una tienda de insumos para el hogar, y con sus nuevos ingresos ha podido ayudar más a su hija en sus estudios, por el momento no tiene dificultades en desarrollar sus actividades.
Como una manera de seguir progresando solicita un nuevo préstamo con el que comprara arroz, aceite, bebidas, frijoles, verduras, etc., tanto para la tienda como para elaborar la comida rápida que vende, tendrá a su disposición los recursos económicos con los que piensa seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Elsy is very grateful for the support brought by her previous loan, as it has strengthened her business. She says that today, as income-generating activity, she has the sale of fast food and a store with supplies for the home. With her new income she has been able to better support her daughter's education. At the moment she has no trouble developing her activities.

As a way to further progress, she requests a new loan with which she will buy rice, oil, drinks, beans, vegetables, etc., as much for the store as to prepare the fast food she sells. She will then have available the financial resources with which she plans to continue working.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, drinks, beans, vegetables, etc., as much for her store as to prepare the fast food she sells

loans.name: Azucena Virtud

texts.es:
Azucena se decidió a solicitar un  nuevo financiamiento por los buenos resultados que le dan al invertirlos en su negocio, en esta oportunidad lo utilizara para comprar insumos agrícolas para ejecutar la siembra de maíz y frijol, otra parte le servirá para costear los gastos de recolección de la cosecha de la siembra anterior, espera mantener la continuidad de su negocio.
Gracias a la ayuda de los créditos puede tener un negocio rentable que le da los medios para subsistir junto a su familia, comenta que sus cultivos tienen un mejor desarrollo y que las cosechas que saca son más abundantes.
texts.en:
Azucena decided to apply for another loan due to the good results that previous loans have had when the money was invested in her business. This time she will use the loan to buy farming supplies in order to plant corn and beans. Some of the loan will also be used to cover the collection costs from the previous harvest. She hopes to maintain the sustainability of her business.

Thanks to the financial support from the loans, she is able to have a profitable business which provides her with the means to survive along with her family. She describes how her crops are now better developed and that her harvests are more abundant.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies in order to plant corn and beans. Some of the loan will also be used to cover the collection costs from the previous harvest.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is 30 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles such as motorbikes, motor cars, and auto rickshaws. He renews the interior parts of engines of vehicles, renewing the turbine and radiators. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady. Due to continuously working over the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. Without the replacement of parts it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Ayesha's husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe machine or buy cutting tools. She requested a loan, which her husband will use to fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools to work over the lathe machine. Ayesha hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to fix the lathe and to purchase some cutting tools for her husband's machine shop.

loans.name: Maria Silveria

texts.es:
María necesita de un nuevo crédito para comprar fertilizantes con los que cuidara mejor de los cultivos de frijol y maíz, espera tener una buena producción para alimentar a su familia y abastecer a sus clientes, tiene fe en recuperar la inversión y pagar su deuda a tiempo.
Utilizo el crédito anterior para poder realizar los trabajos agrícolas de la temporada, pero debido a la sequía que afectó en el periodo comprendido de mayo – agosto, los resultados fueron que perdió por completo la cosecha por lo que su situación financiera no ha cambiado.
texts.en:
Maria needs a new loan to buy fertilizers so that she can take better care of her bean and corn crops.  She hopes to get a good production to feed her family and supply to her customers.  She has faith that she will recover her investment and pay off her loan on time.

Maria used her previous loan to invest in her last harvest.  However, due to the drought over the period between May and August she lost all of her crops.  Therefore, her financial situation has not improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita thanks Kiva and CCT for their tireless financial and moral support of her livelihood. She has received a number of loans which certainly helped her have a productive harvest on her farm, thus providing income to feed her children and send them to school.

To expand her farm, she is again seeking assistance of PHP 35,000 for more farm seedlings and fertilizer for a more productive harvest. Although her harvest is affected by typhoons during the rainy season, she still maintains her faith that her future harvest will be plentiful.

Julita continues to dream for a bigger farm and for her children to finish their schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and other supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a single woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past seven years, she has operated a business selling clothes from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 20,000, Mwanajuma wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jose Alvaro

texts.es:
José tiene una situación económica más estable, obtuvo una cosecha abundante de maíz y pudo resarcir su deuda, él agradece que se le haya dado la oportunidad de trabajar con créditos en Padecomsm, pues así ha logrado tener estos resultados tan buenos.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito por los beneficios que le dan y por la facilidad de pago que le brinda la institución, lo invertirá en abono, semilla mejorada de maíz e insecticidas pretende tener todo listo para la próxima siembra en un corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Jose has a more stable economic situation than before. He gathered an abundant harvest of maize and could repay his debt. He appreciates that he has been given the opportunity to work with loans from PADECOMSM, as has thus managed to have these very good results.

He is requesting a new loan for the benefits it gives and for the ease of payment that the institution provides. He will invest it in fertilizer, improved maize seeds, and insecticides. He aims to have everything ready for the next sowing soon.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, improved maize seeds, and insecticides, and intends to have everything ready for the next sowing soon.

loans.name: Balarabe

texts.en:
Balarabe is a maize farmer from Badamasi village. As a Babban Gona member, Balarabe is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Balarabe would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Balarabe can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Balarabe no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land,

Balarabe hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres De Cruz B Group

texts.es:
Lilian es una mujer de 25 años de edad es casada con una familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 5 y 7 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Lilian (la primera del lado derecho en la fotografía)  todos los días se sacrifica mucho para poder obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, ella es panadera desde hace 15 años, su negocio se ubica en una de las principales calles de su comunidad.
Lilian gracias a su amabilidad y generosidad ha logrado que su negocio sea muy reconocido en su comunidad, ahora ha logrado conseguir mucha clientela por esa razón ha considerado necesario una inversión por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para comprar productos como: harina, royal, levadura y azúcar. Sus aspiraciones en la vida son; fortalecer su negocio, contar con su propio local de negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lilian is a 25-year-old woman who is married and has five children between the ages of 5 and 7 years old. This humble family lives in a neighborhood of Solola.

Every day Lilian (first on the right in the photograph) sacrifices a great deal to earn some money and raise her family. She has been a baker for 15 years and her business is located on one of the main streets of her neighborhood. Thanks to her friendliness and generosity, Lilian's business has become very well-known in the area and she has been able to attract a large clientele. This is why she thinks it is necessary to invest in her business, so she is asking for a loan so she can buy items such as flour, Royal baking powder, and sugar.

Her life goals are to strengthen her business, have her own shop, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her bakery such as flour, Royal baking powder, and sugar.

loans.name: Ishaku

texts.en:
Ishaku is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Ishaku is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Ishaku would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

As a member of Babban Gona Ishaku can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Ishaku has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Ishaku is thankful that he no longer has to worry about not having money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en:
Saeda is 27 years ‎old and suffered a major shock with the death of her husband. She carried this hurt and was very ‎broken.‎

Saeda lives in southern Ghour and has no children. Although very sad to lose her husband, she decided to start a new chapter in her life and depend on herself. Saeda started her own business ‎selling clothes and cosmetics. Her business is working out well and she likes what she is doing.‎

This is her second loan after repaying the previous loan successfully. Saeda will use the money to purchase more ‎cosmetics and children's and women`s clothes to sell, increasing her income. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.‎

loans.use: to purchase more ‎cosmetics and children's and women's clothes to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Chuachinup Group

texts.es:
Catarina  es una mujer de 36 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 5 y 17 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina (la que se ubica en medio de blusa celeste) para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, con este negocio lleva 6 años de realizarlo.
Catarina con el afán de mejorar sus servicios ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para realizar una inversión en su negocio, pues la época de fin de año se está acercando por lo que la demanda la ropa típica, con esta inversión ella comprara güipiles, fajas y cortes.
Sus aspiraciones en la vida son tener su propio local para su negocio, fortalecer su negocio y pagar los estudios de los hijos.
texts.en:
