Catarina is a 36 year old woman, married, with a lovely family of seven children between the ages of 5 and 17. This family lives in a Sololá community.

Catarina (the one in the middle with a blue shirt), in order to get her income and support her children, makes a living buying and selling traditional clothing. She has been working on this business for 6 years.

Catarina, in her eagerness to improve her services, has decided to request a loan to invest in her business given that the end of the year season is approaching, so there is demand for traditional clothing. With this investment she will buy traditional tunics, woven belts and traditional Mayan skirts.

Her aspirations in life are to have her own space for her business, to strengthen her business and to pay for her children's studies.

loans.use: to buy clothing articles such as traditional tunics, woven belts and traditional Mayan skirts.

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.ru: Абдуллочон мужчина в возрасте 59 лет проживающий в селькой местности. Как и многие сельские жители Абдуллочон занимается разведением и откормом скота. Животноводством Абдуллочон начал заниматься после окончания школы. До этого он помогал отцу ухаживать за скотом. После окончания школы Абдуллочон решил заняться бизнесом и на накопленные деньги купил пару молодых бычков, откормив их 4 месяца продал за более высокую цену. Таким образом он постепенно смог расширить свое стадо и получать больше прибыли. Благодаря своему бизнесу он смог обеспечивать свою семью, построить дом и женить своих детей. Семья Абдуллочона активно помогает ему в ведении бизнеса и ухаживают за скотом. На данный момент в связи с упадком цен на скот Абдуллочон хочет взять кредит и закупить несколько голов молодых бычков. С данной проблемой он решил обратиться в "АРВАНД" за поддержкой. На полученные деньги он закупит скот и корм для скота на зиму.
texts.en: Abdullojon is a 59-year-old man living in a rural location. Like many other rural residents, Abdullojon rears and fattens cattle. Abdullojon began rearing animals after leaving school. Prior to that he would help his father look after the livestock. On finishing school Abdullojon decided to run a business and bought a couple of young bulls with his savings. He fattened them up for four months and sold them for a higher price. In this way he was gradually able to expand his herd and get more profit. Thanks to his business, he has been able to provide for his family, build a house and marry off his children. Abdullojon's family actively helps him to run the business and they look after the cattle. At the present time, as a result of the fall in the price of cattle, Abdullojon wants to take a loan and buy a few young bulls. He has applied to Arvand for support with this problem. He will buy some cattle and some cattle feed for the winter with the money he receives.

loans.use: to buy some cattle.

loans.name: Kadiriye

texts.en:
Kadiriye is married and a mother of two.  She makes trousseaus and printed scarfs  at home.  With the help of her first loan she bought bulks of fabric, made trousseaus and made money.  With the help of the second loan she is planning to buy bulks of fabric and thread, make her products, sell them, and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Kadiriye hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Evde çeyiz işi yapıyor yazma alarak yazma satışı yapıyor.  Birinci kullandığı kredi ile kumaş aldı çeyiz yaptı satarak para kazandı.  Aldığı ikinci mikro kredi ile çeyizlik kumaş ve  ip alarak işleyerek satarak işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Jiey-Ann

texts.en:
Jiey-Ann is 31 years old and has three children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Jiey-Ann is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy feed and additional livestock to raise.

She has been raising livestock for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jiey-Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es: Doña Blanca, de 47 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo, 2 hijos y dos nietos en una de las aldeas de Tela, Atlántida. Ella elaboraba tortillas de maíz para vender, pero hace cinco años decidió por establecer una pulpería donde vende productos como ser golosinas, pollo, carnes, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, huevos, productos de aseo y otros abarrotes. Ya ha invertido varios préstamos al negocio, actualmente solicita el cuarto ciclo que es por 6,000 Lempiras para surtir con más productos como granos básicos, refrescos, pan, lácteos y golosinas para obtener una mayor cantidad de ventas. Su meta es Ampliar su negocio y seguir ayudando a la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: 47-year-old Blanca is married, lives with her husband, 2 children and 2 grandchildren in a village in the Tela region in Atlantida, Honduras. She makes corn tortillas for sale and 5 years ago decided to open a small convenience store where she sells products such as candy, chicken, meat, soft drinks, grains, bread, eggs, cleaning products and other items. She has already invested money from several loans in her business. She is requesting a fourth loan for 6,000 Honduran lempiras to stock her business with additional products such as grains, soft drinks, bread, dairy products and candy in order to increase her sales. Her goal is to expand her business and continue supporting her children's education.

loans.use: to stock her convenience store with additional products such as grains, soft drinks, bread, dairy products and candy.

loans.name: Beronica De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Beronica, es soltera, no tiene hijos ni recibe ayuda de remesas, la única persona que depende de ella es su madre, su fuente de ingresos es dedicarse a vender ropa desde hace 2 años, trabaja con un horario de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades para trabajar.
Para tener un mejor inventario está necesitando de un préstamo para invertir en variedad de prendas de vestir como: vestidos, camisas, blusas, pantalones y ropa interior, con ello tendrá más  oportunidades de atraer nuevos clientes, tener mejores ventas e ingresos.
La visión que ella tiene es mejorar la competitividad de su negocio y atender mejor a su clientela.
texts.en:
Beronica is single. She doesn't have any children and does not receive any remittance money. Her mother is her only dependent. For the past two years, she has been selling clothing for a living. Her work schedule is from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. So far her business hasn't run into any problems.

In order to improve her inventory, she needs a loan to invest in assorted clothing items such as dresses, shirts, blouses, pants, and underwear. This will allow her to increase her chances of attracting new customers, make more sales, and increase her income.

Her vision is to make her business more competitive and better serve her customer base.

loans.use: to invest in a variety of clothing items.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: Ellas son las integrantes del grupo comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN”. Un grupo conformado por 5 mujeres emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Una de ellas es la Sra. Ana de 59 años de edad casada y con 2 hijas mayores. La  Sra. Ana  es  muy trabajadora y emprendedora que a base  de su esfuerzo ha sabido superarse y sacar a su familia adelante. La Sra.  Ana trabaja ya hace 13 años en la venta de huevos (pollo) al por mayor el cual es su única fuente de ingresos para ella y su familia. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá para la compra de más huevos de pollo y  así  poder  seguir generando más ingresos. La Sra. Ana es la segunda persona de la mano derecha se  le distingue por un polo de distintos colores y un chaleco de color negro. A la vez  la Sra. Ana y todos los integrantes del grupo se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se les ha brindado y se  despiden  dejando la promesa  que cumplirán todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
They are the members of the "VIRGEN DEL CARMEN" communal group. A group comprised of five entrepreneurial women who have much creativity for business.

One of them is Mrs. Ana, 59 years old, married and with two adult daughters. Mrs. Ana is very hard working and entreprenurial and, through her effort, has been able to improve herself and support her family. Mrs. Ana has already been working selling eggs (chicken) in bulk for the past 13 years. This is the only source of income for her and her family. She will invest the granted loan in the purchase of additional chicken eggs, and that way she'll be able to generate more income.

Mrs. Ana is the second person on the right, and she can be identified by a shirt of various colors and a black vest.

Mrs. Ana and all the members of the group are grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for the granted loan and for the trust that has been provided, and they say goodbye with a promise to fulfill all their set goals.

loans.use: to buy more chicken eggs.

loans.name: Atilio

texts.es:
Atilio es una persona que en la actualidad se dedica únicamente a trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, oficio que desempeña desde hace 50 años, tiene una gran experiencia que lo respalda; en cuanto a su familia dice que es acompañado, es padre de tres hijos, dos ya son independientes y le ayudan económicamente de vez en cuando.
Piensa comprar insumos agrícolas para continuar cultivando granos básicos, espera tener una producción de mayor calidad para alimentar a su grupo familiar y vender mucho más, pues de igual manera sus ingresos mejoraran y podrá cumplir con sus obligaciones.
A don Atilio siempre le gustado sentirse útil, por tal razón su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para salir adelante y no depender en totalidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Atilio is a person who currently works solely in farming, growing staple grains, a job he has worked at for 50 years. He has great experience to back him up. As far as his family, he says he has a partner and is the father of three children. Two are now independent and support him economically from time to time.

He plans to buy agricultural supplies to continue growing staple grains. He hopes to have a production of higher quality to feed his family group, and sell much more. In this way his earnings will increase and he will be able to comply with his obligations. Atilio has always liked to feel useful. For that reason his dream is to continue working in order to get ahead and not depend completely on his children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to continue growing staple grains, in the hope of having a production of better quality to feed his family group, and sell much more.

loans.name: Aracelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracelis, está muy contenta por tener un impacto positivo en la venta de ropa, pues el crédito anterior le dio un aporte importante para mejorar la mercadería que ofrece a sus clientes, dice haber tenido un incremento en las ventas e ingresos, además confirma tener el mismo núcleo familiar pero que hoy en día tienen un mejor estilo de vida.
Con la finalidad de tener una mejor imagen de su negocio está solicitando un nuevo crédito con el que comprara ganchos y estantes para exhibir las prendas de vestir, considera que así tendrá la facilidad de atraer a nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
Aracelis has been very happy to see a positive impact on her clothing sales, with her previous loan making an important contribution to improving the goods she offers to her customers. She says that both her sales and  earnings have increased. She also says that her family group remains the same, but they now have a better lifestyle.

In order to improve her business´ image, she is requesting a new loan to buy hooks and shelves to showcase her clothes. She believes this will enable her to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy hooks and shelves to showcase her clothes.

loans.name: Samar's Group

texts.en:
Samar and Salam are young women who have willpower and want to improve their lives. They live in Dairalla and they are ‎working hard to overcome the difficult conditions of their lives.
‎
Samar is 29 years old and single. Salam is 21 years old and married. They are working as farmers with low income ‎and, because they are searching for better lives, they decided to open their own business, which is selling blankets. This idea ‎came to them because there are no shops that sell blankets in their region.
‎
Now, Samara and Salam want to expand their business. Therefore, they applied for a loan to help them buy more blankets to ‎sell and to add clothes trading to their business to increase their incomes and improve the standards of living of their ‎families.‎

loans.use: to buy more blankets to ‎sell and to add clothes trading to her business to increase her income.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra, who is in her mid-30s, is married with one child who is still in school. She has been running a beauty salon for three years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nasra's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment and meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of expanding her salon to the level of owning another beauty shop.

Nasra will be responsible for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment and meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Mamadsharif

texts.en:
Mamadsharif is a kind man. He is a married parent of three children.

Mahmadsharif lives in a rural area with his family, and he has been busy with the farming business. He has land where he grows a variety of vegetables. Mahmadsharif has additional income from animal husbandry. He feeds sheep.

Mahmadsharif now needs financial support because his wife is ill. He is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy medicines for treatment of his wife. He and his wife await your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of his wife.

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 43-year-old, married mother of two. Since 2009, she has been working, selling clothes from her house to support her husband, who works with a limited monthly salary, to cover their family's living needs and develop their lives.

Abir is a hard-working woman who puts so much effort into developing her business and replying to her customers' needs.

Her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a special men's, women's, and children's winter clothes collection.

This is Abir's first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that, through future relationships, her acquired loans will be invested in expanding her business, opening a clothes-selling shop outside her house.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special men's, women's, and children's winter clothes collection.

loans.name: Krissia Ivon

texts.es:
Krissia es un apersona emprendedora, que después de tantos esfuerzos hoy es propietaria de una tienda de productos de la canasta básica, ya tiene 3 años de haber hecho la apertura de su negocio y lo hizo para disminuir las necesidades familiares, Krissia es acompañada, comparte la vivienda con su pareja y sus hijos, los cuales aún son menores de edad.
Con el crédito piensa abastecer su negocio comprando azúcar, harina, sal, huevos, jugos, condimentos, etc., considera que de esta manera disminuirá las necesidades de sus clientes y podrá incrementar sus utilidades.
Los objetivos que ella tiene son mantener la responsabilidad de atender bien a sus clientes así como también ser un ejemplo para que sus hijos sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Krissia is an enterprising person, who, after a great deal of effort, now owns a grocery store. She opened her business three years ago in order to reduce her family´s needs. She has a partner, and shares her home with her partner and her children, who are still young. 

Krissia plans to use the loan to stock her business with sugar, flour, salt, eggs, juices, condiments and other items in order to reduce her customers´ needs and increase her profits.

Her goals are to continue taking repsonsibility for providing good customer service, and to be a role model so that her children become upstanding citizens.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, salt, eggs, juices, condiments and other items in order to reduce her customers´ needs.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is 25 years old and single. He lives in Al Irbid with his parents and four siblings. His father is retired with a ‎low retirement salary and his mother does not work. 

Issa is studying for his bachelor degree majoring in accounting. His future ‎plan is to earn his bachelor degree and work in his field. Lately his family faced financial problems that prevented them from paying ‎Issa`s education fees. He is requesting an educational loan, which he will use to cover his semester fees.‎

loans.use: to pay semester and registration fees

loans.name: Nevin

texts.en:
Nevin is married and has two children.  She started working in order to make a contribution to the family budget.  She sells underwear from home to her neighbors on gathering days.  She requested another loan, which she will use to buy bulks of underwear to sell.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Nevin hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Nevin hanım aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için çalışmaya başlamış.  Evde çamaşır satışı yapıyor.  Satışlarını günlerde ve tanıdıklarına yapıyor.  Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan çamaşır alarak satarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 36 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, canned goods, school supplies, and other groceries.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jane. She is 45 years old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She has a cafe, a business she has been operating for the last twenty five years. She is grateful to have acquired Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training in savings, enterprise development and financial management and she has acquired the skills to manage her business prudently. She is borrowing from Kiva to enable her to purchase more foodstuffs for resale in her cafe in order to increase her income. This will help meet her family's basic needs and pay school fees for her children.

Jane is thankful for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for resale in her cafe in order to increase her income. This will help meet her family's basic needs and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hoima Public School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Harriet. She is the head teacher of Hoima Public School, a mixed school in the urban area of Hoima with 1,300 students.

Hoima Public School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1,000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Hoima Public School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Harriet ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children who fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Marvin Josue

texts.es:
Marvin, de 26 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y muy dedicado a sus responsabilidades laborales, muy conocido en su comunidad por su excelente comportamiento y por su alto grado de servicio a los demás, está acompañad y vive con su pareja y sus dos hijas.


Marvin, trabaja como promotor de salud de su comunidad, él se dedica a visitar todas las casas de su comunidad para dar charlas de saneamiento básico y hábitos de higiene y también lleva el control de las vacunad de los niños y niñas es empleado de la unidad de salud de su municipio; tiene 3 años de experiencia y está es su principal fuente de ingresos.


Marvin, necesita el préstamo para comprar una motocicleta, la cual le servirá para desplazarse para su lugar de trabajo,  y realizar las vivitas de campo, de esta manera le resultara más fácil viajar a su trabajo y en el entorno de su comunidad.

Los sueños de Marvin, son tener una vivienda propia y apoyar en la educación de sus hijas.
texts.en:
Marvin is 26 years old. He is a very hardworking man who is highly dedicated to his work responsibilities. He is well known in his community for his excellent behaviour and the high level of service he gives to others. He has a partner and lives with his partner and two daughters.

Marvin works as a health promoter in his community. He visits all the houses in his community to give talks on basic sanitation and good hygiene, and also manages the vaccination programme for children. He is an employee of his town´s health unit. He has three years´ experience and it is his main source of income.

Marvin needs the loan to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to travel to work and make visits in the countryside. It will make it easier for him to travel to work and around his community.

Marvin dreams of having his own home and supporting his daughters in their education.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to travel to work.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.es:
La Sra. Margaret, es natural de la Santa Cruz, pero lleva viviendo por más de 10 años en la ciudad de Tarija, donde independientemente emprendió el negocio de una salteñeria. Tiene cuatro hijos a quienes colabora moral y económicamente.
Comentar que la señora cuenta con gran experiencia en la elaboración de empanadas y salteñas, con el préstamo desea mejorar las condiciones de su casa para poder brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes, piensa techar ya que se viene la época de las lluvias y de esa forma brindar mejores condiciones a sus clientes y de esa forma mejorar además sus ingresos.
Su esposo es asalariado cuenta con una estabilidad laboral, colaborándole en los gastos familiares. Es una familia unida que con mucho sacrificio y constancia en las labores que desarrollan pudieron surgir y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, por quienes indican que día a día les impulsa a seguir adelante con los proyectos que tienen a futuro.
texts.en:
Margaret is originally from Santa Cruz, but has been living in the town of Tarija for over ten years. Here she started her own food business selling salteñas. She has four children whom she supports.

She has lots of experience making empanadas and salteñas. She wants to use this loan to improve the condition of her home so that she can offer her customers good service. She plans to install a new roof, because the rainy season is approaching. This will allow her customers to be more comfortable and her income will improve.

Her husband has a steady job and salary, so he contributes to their household expenses. They are a tight-knit family whose self-sacrifice, perseverance, and hard work have allowed them to get ahead and give their children better living standards. They say their kids are their motivation to keep going and carry out their projects for the future.

loans.use: to remodel the house where she serves her customers.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a maize farmer from Dantani village. As a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ezekiel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ezekiel can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ezekiel no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Ezekiel hopes to realize better yields, and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en:
Souad is 24 years old and single. She is the sole breadwinner for her family. She operates a bookstore, selling books and stationery, which she has been doing for seven years. She got the required experience from her father. 

Souad is requesting her third youth loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to make necessary decoration to her bookstore especially painting the walls and  to increase her books capital with newly released editions and special released stationery for the current scholastic year. She use her previous loans to develop her business, since most of her acquired income is invested in covering her family's living needs. Souad hopes to continue developing and improving her business in a well managed way so she can continue to cover her family's needs and reply to customers' requests.

loans.use: to decorate her bookstore especially painting the walls and to purchase books and stationery

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a 54-year-old widow with two children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lolita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lolita has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo, de 41 años de edad, es una persona con buenos principios, carece de estudios porque desde pequeño se dedica a la agricultura junto a su padre, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.
 
Leonardo, tiene 20 años de experiencia en trabajos de agricultura, esta actividad la aprendió gracias a sus padres, quienes siempre se dedicaron a este oficio y esto le ha servido actualmente para generar ingresos para su familia.

Leonardo, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y para comprar un granero para almacenar sus granos. 

Los sueños de Leonardo, son apoyar en la educación de sus hijos e implementar una porqueriza para criar cerdos.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a 41 year old man with good principles. He is uneducated because he has worked in agriculture along side his father since he was a child. He is married and lives with his wife and four children.

Leonardo has twenty years of experience in agriculture. He learned about agriculture from his parents who have always made their living from this work and it is how he currently earns money for his family.

Leonardo needs this loan to buy farm supplies and to buy a granary to store his grain. His dreams are to help his children get an education and install a pigsty to raise pigs.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to buy a granary to store his grain.

loans.name: Nyakasenyi Tulibamwe Group

texts.en:
Euphrazia is a 47-year-old, hardworking widow with six children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. Three of her children attend school and that is her happiness. She grows and sells coffee, alongside the selling of secondhand clothes.

She has been doing the two businesses for over seven years, and from the proceeds she has been able to buy food and pay school fees for her children. Her hope is that she would like to increase her capital, and expand her business into a wholesale store, but competition and bad weather have been her main hindrances. She needs a loan to buy pesticides for her coffee plantation.

She is a member of Nyakasenyi Tulibamwe Group where members guarantee each other to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Eria

texts.en:
Eria is 22 years old and single. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a produce business where he works 12 hours a day operating in a busy market of Fort Portal. He started this business with a hope of employing himself and earning more income for his family. Eria promised to pay school fees for his younger brother until he completes university and is working hard to fulfill his promise. He is faced with the challenge of increased competition and of his stock perishing very fast hence lowering his profits. 

Eria requested a loan, which he will use to buy more posho and beans to sell. He hopes to buy land and construct a house.

loans.use: to purchase more posho and beans to sell.

loans.name: Angel Blas

texts.es:
Ángel, de 53 años de edad, es una persona con excelentes principios, se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales y vitaminas naturales, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad. 

Ángel, se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales desde hace 5 años, ha formado parte de diplomados en medicina natural y popular, esta actividad la aprendió con su madre quien también se dedicaba a la venta de medicinas y de esa manera ha salido adelante y actualmente es su principal fuente de ingresos.

Ángel, necesita el préstamo para comprar más medicina natural, porque se acerca la temporada de fin de año y es una buena temporada para la venta de productos vitaminados.

Los sueños de Ángel, es tener una tienda de granos básicos y comprar un vehículo para ir a vender a otras comunidades de su cantón.
texts.en:
Ángel is 53 years old. He is a person with excellent principles. He works selling medicinal products and natural vitamins. He lives with his wife and their three children, who attend school in the community. Ángel started selling medicinal products 5 years ago. He is part of the professionals in natural and popular medicine. He learned this business from his mother, who also worked in the sale of medicines. Through his business he has gotten ahead. It is currently his primary source of income.

Ángel needs the loan to buy more natural medicine, because the end of year season is approaching, which is a good time to sell vitamin products. Ángel's dream is to have a staple grains store, and to buy a vehicle to go sell in other communities in his canton.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru, who is in her early 40s, is married with four schooling children. She has been running two projects, food vending and selling cold drinks, for 12 years now. She works from 6am to 4pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Nuru's 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and to start selling cold drinks. She is doing fine with the loan and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, buy a plot of land, pay the shop rent, reinvest in her business and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her food store and to increase the cold drinks. She dreams of selling cigarettes at retail and wholesale prices.

Nuru will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her food store and to increase the cold drinks.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is 44 years old. He is married and blessed with two children. His business is farming. He has been in the business for seven years. He earns a monthly income of forty eight thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is his fifth loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs of seeds, fertilizer and farm chemicals. He will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of seeds, fertilizer and farm chemicals.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La señora Rosaura es una mujer de 44 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 4 años, trabaja en la producción de leche. Doña Rosaura tiene 19 años de experiencia en el rubro, ella desea comprar alimento y realizar un pequeño silo (almacén) para su ganado. Tiene buenos conocimientos en el rubro cuenta con 14 cabezas de ganado vacuno. La señora cuenta con buenas expectativas ya que a ella lo que más le motiva es salir adelante y con varias metas por realizar, quiere llegar a formar un capital de trabajo que le pueda brindar la ampliación de su actividad, para así también aumentar su producción, y poder tener mejores ingresos.
Doña Rosaura viene de una familia humilde y sobre todo trabajadora la cual esta inculcada con los valores de humildad, buena administración de recursos, respeto, con una visión de emprendimiento y alcanzar los objetivos que ella misma se traza a lo largo del desempeño de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 44 years old. She has a 4 year old son. She works in milk production. She has 19 years experience in this field. She wants to buy food and make a small silo (warehouse) for her cattle. She has good knowledge in this field. She has 14 heads of cattle. She has good expectations since what motivates her most is to get ahead. She has many goals to accomplish. She wants to acquire working capital that would allow her to increase her business, as well as increase her production. She also wants to be able to increase her earnings.

Rosaura comes from a humble, and above all hardworking, family. She has been instilled with the values of humility, good administration of resources, and respect. She has an entrepreneurial vision to reach the objectives she herself sets, through her work.

loans.use: to buy food and make a small silo (warehouse) for her cattle, in order to increase her production and generate greater income for her family.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during the Easter season. She still sells second-hand clothes as her main source of income.

The main reason why Gladys ventured into this business was to supplement her husband's income, which was not enough to sustain their family. Her customers are both adults and children. She currently faces the challenges of competition, high inflation rates and seasonal markets for her clothes but she has hopes of owning a wholesale boutique and educating her child.

Gladys is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Valencia

texts.en:
Valencia is 38 years old and married with five children.

Valencia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a grocery store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of feed, rice, canned goods and groceries to sell.

Valencia has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the grocery store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Valencia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of feed, rice, canned goods and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kader

texts.en:
Kader is married and a mother of two. In order to make a contribution to the family budget, she is selling cosmetics from home. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bulks of cosmetics and beauty products, sell them and make money.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:

Kader hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamak için evde kozmetik ürünleri satışı yapıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan kozmetik ürünleri ve güzellik malzemesi alarak satarak para kazanmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Maiúnguwa

texts.en:
Maiúnguwa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Maiúnguwa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Maiúnguwa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Maiúnguwa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Maiúnguwa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Maiúnguwa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en: Nazeeran is 60 years old and a mother of eight children. She is a housewife, who together with her daughters, looks after the household. One of her son has owned a gold shop for eight years now, and he wants to renovate his shop. That is why his mother, Nazeeran, applied for the loan amount; to help her son in what he is aiming for. She is very happy with Kiva platform and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her son's gold shop.

loans.name: Julio

texts.pt:
Senhor Júlio tem 36 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos menores com idade estudantil, é técnico de administração pública, vive em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cimento, areia, blocos, varões para dar continuidade a construção de muro de vedação da sua casa.
No futuro pretende terminar a construção da sua casa e comprar carro para o transporte pessoal.
Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora é o seu maior desafio de modo a solicitar mais pedidos com forma de lograr de forma célere os seus projectos
texts.en:
Júlio is 36 years old, married, and the father of three children who go to school. He is a Public Administration Technician, and lives with his family in a house he owns.

He will use the requested amount to buy cement, sand, bricks, and columns to continue building a division wall at home.

In the future, he is planning to finish building his house and buy a vehicle to transport himself. His biggest challenge is paying off the loan without defaulting, so that he can apply for more loans and finish his projects more quickly.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and columns to continue building a division wall at home.

loans.name: Argam

texts.en:
This young farmer is 26 years old and his name is Argam. He lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. Argam lives with his parents and brother and the whole family is engaged in farming where they have cows, calves, a bull, a pig, sheep and chickens.

Argam perfectly organizes the sale of his farm products such as meat, which he sells to city butchers; he also sells milk, cheese, macun (national dairy-product) and eggs. In order to earn some more money, Argam also does different construction work around his village. This young farmer is so hardworking and with his brother, they work hard to cover their family's needs and take care of their parents as properly as they did when Argam and his brother were little boys.

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams Argam is asking for will be used to make his farm richer with cattle. He plans to buy a cow, a calf and also fodder for his farm cattle, which he has started to store for the long winter period.

loans.use: to buy a cow, a calf and also fodder for his farm cattle, which he has started to store for the long winter period.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has one school-aged child. Her husband represents the main income provider, and he works hard in order to make enough money to be able to pay their heavy life expenses.

Eva works as a graphic designer. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., to pay for school registration fees for her child and to buy his books. She said that she is very content and willing to benefit from this loan to continue her son's education.

loans.use: to pay school registration fees for her child and to buy his books.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en: Sabah is a 57-year-old married mother of two children who are both still attending school. Her husband is main income source in the family. Sabah is dedicated to her children. In order to pay her children’s educational fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She wants them to complete their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.name: Matiya

texts.en:
Matiya lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is married and also takes care of one more relative who lives with him.

Matiya used his previous loan to buy fertilizer, manure, and pesticide for his coffee garden. He currently deals in brick-making as a major source of income, alongside farming and motorcycle transport, which earn him additional income. He has managed to increase his monthly income and pay school fees for his children.

Matiya intends to buy a pickup vehicle to enable him to transport his produce to the market and to be rich and self-sustaining. Without borrowed funds though, he faces a challenge of insufficient funds to carry out his projects at once.

Matiya is requesting a loan to pay workers on his brick-making site and buy firewood to use for burning the bricks.

loans.use: to pay workers on his brick-making site and buy firewood to use for burning the bricks.

loans.name: Keriman

texts.en:
Keriman is a married mother of two. She sells underwear from her home. She sells during the women's gathering days. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy underwear in bulk and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Keriman hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Evden çamaşır satışı yapıyor. Çamaşırları günlerde ve yakınlarına satıyor. Aldığı mikro kredi ile toptan çamaşır alarak satarak para kazanmak ve işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a very vigilant and good manager of her household and clothing services business which she has operated for seven years. She is married and has four children. She and her family live in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Shazia manages her business properly and benefits from it but now she is falling short of the savings she needs. So, she is not able to buy the seasonal cloth for her business. She has applied for the loan and is thankful to Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth for her sewing services.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado con mucho sacrificio, está casada, su esposo se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas, tienen 3 hijos.

Martha, necesita el préstamo para comprar 1,000 plantas de café y comprar insumos para cuidar las plantas para obtener mejores resultados y así cubrir sus necesidades. 

Martha, sueña con poder cultivar 70,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo agrícola, porque de esa manera sus ingresos mejorarán.
texts.en:
Martha is 39 years old. With much sacrifice she went to school until the ninth grade. She's married. Her husband does agricultural jobs. They have 3 children.

Martha needs the loan to buy 1000 coffee plants and to buy supplies to care for the plants, in order to obtain better results and thereby cover their necessities. Martha dreams of being able to plant 70,000 square meters of agriculture, because in that way her earnings would increase.

loans.use: to buy 1000 coffee plants and to buy supplies to care for the plants, in order to obtain better results and thereby cover their necessities.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Massinga Província de Inhambane tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade, dos quais 2 frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2010, este é o seu sétimo empréstimo na Hluvuku, com o qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: cimento, areia, portas e aros de janelas para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência, mobiliar, construir um estabelecimento comercial e garantir a formação dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
She was born in Massinga, Inhambane province. She is 36 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and is the mother of three underage children. Two of them go to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2010. This is her seventh loan from Hluvuku. She is planning to use it to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, doors, and window frames to continue building her house.

In the future, she is planning to finish building her house, furnish it, build a commercial establishment, and guarantee her children's education up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, doors and window frames to continue building her house.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha Província de Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade é solteira mãe de 1 filho menor de idade que frequenta a Escola, não responsabiliza se por ninguém. 
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2013, este e o seu quarto empréstimo na Hluvuku com qual pretende adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, varões e mais para dar continuidade com a sua obra de residência.	
Futuramente pretende adquirir uma viatura e dar continuidade com os estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
She was born in the Namaacha disctrict, Maputo province. She is 31 years old, single, and the mother of an underage son who goes to school. She is not responsible for anyone else.

She started to work with Hluvuku in 2013. This is her fourth loan from Hluvuku, and she plans to use it to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, columns, and other materials to continue building her house.

In the future, she plans to buy a vehicle and continue with her studies up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, columns, and other materials to continue building her house.

loans.name: Santita Marizol

texts.es:
La Sra. Santita es una persona activa, responsable y emprendedora que desea realizar un emprendimiento en producción de embutidos, para esto la Sra. Santita participo y aprobó el curso técnico básico en la carrera de "Elaboración de productos Cárnicos", estos cursos se realizan bajo el convenio de FAUTAPO y CEA THAQU THAQU, que son instituciones que brindan capacitación y apoyo a emprendimientos productivos en la región de Mizque. 
Actualmente por las tardes la Sra. Santita trabaja como profesora por las mañanas se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan en su domicilio particular, la elaboración de pan lo aprendió de su madre ahora para mejorar sus ingresos en su tiempo libre por las mañanas se dedica a elaborar y vender pan, como se menciona antes la Señora es una persona emprendedora por tal razón invertirá en: la compra de plantas de uva, viguetas, alambres y otros para el cultivo de uva con el fin de mejorar la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Santita is an active, responsible and enterprising person that wants to start producing cold meats. For this reason Santita attended and passed a basic technical course in "The Production of Meat Products". These courses are conducted under the agreement of Fautapo and Thaqu Thaqu CEA, the institutions that provide training and support for productive enterprises in the Mizque region. 

In the evening, Santita is currently working as a teacher whilst in the morning she makes and sells bread from her private home. She learnt how to make bread from her mum and now does this in order to improve her income. As mentioned earlier, Santita is an enterprising person and for that reason she will invest in: grape plants, beams and wire, among other items needed in order to grow grapes. This is with the aim of improving her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to buy grape plants, beams and wire, among other items needed in order to grow grapes. This is with the aim of improving her family's financial situation.

loans.name: Taguhi

texts.en:
Taguhi lives in Geghamavan village of Gegharkunik region. She has three sons and all of them are already married, and they live with their families. Taguhi has a vocational education and specialty of a tailor. She worked in that sphere many years, and she says during her life, her profession turned to be very useful. She sewed nice clothes for both her family, and she also used to take private orders.

Now she is engaged in farming, and she just has no time to do her beloved work. In her farm she has cows, bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. With the help of her beloved husband, Taguhi manages the work in her farm. She also sells from her farm a nice assortment of farm products such as milk, meat, butter, cheese and eggs.

This Kiva loan that Taguhi asks for, she is sure will be very helpful for her farming works. She will use the loan of 700,000 AMD for the purchase of one more cow, and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: for the purchase of one more cow, and also fodder for all her farm cattle, which will be very helpful for her farming works.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 28-year-old married mother of three children ages 9, 4 and 1. Joan and her family live in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She operates a boutique business where she works 12 hours a day. Joan has been in this business for seven years now. She started her business with a hope of employing herself and eradicating poverty in her home.

She is facing the hardship of price fluctuations which is preventing her from expanding her business, and loss of customers..In the future,Joan intends to buy land and construct a house plus buy a car.

Joan has asked for a loan to buy new clothes to sell during this festive season.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell during this festive season.

loans.name: Secil

texts.en:
Seçil is 28 years old and has one child. She is working part time as a swimming trainer. The rest of her time she is making decorative products from wooden and glass paintings and beaded covers for living rooms.

She sells her products on the Internet. With the help of this loan from Maya, she is planning to buy beads and wood and glass paints in bulk. In the future, she wants to open a workshop where she can design and sell her products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Seçil Hanım 28 yaşında evli ve 1 çocuk annesi. Seçil Hanım part time yüzme antrenörlüğü yapıyor. Geri kalan zamanlarında ahşap ve cam boyamadan dekoratif ürünler ve boncuktan salon takımları yapıyor. Ürünlerinin satışını internet üzerinden yapan Seçil Hanım Maya dan kullandığı kredi ile toptan boncuk ve ahşap cam boyası alacak. Seçil Hanım gelecekte ürünlerini daha kolay tasarlayabileceği bir atölye açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy beads and wood and glass paints.

loans.name: Sakine

texts.en:
Sakine is married and a mother of two. For many years she had taught sewing to many women. She wanted to do her own business. First she bought a sewing machine and started to sew local dresses at home by getting orders.

With the help of the loan, she is planning to buy embroidery threads, make local dresses, make money and expand her business.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:
Sakine hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Uzun yıllar dikişle ilgili usta öğreticilik yapmış. Birçok öğrenci yetiştirmiş. Kendi işini yapmak istemiş evine önce bir dikiş makinesi almış, evden siparişler alarak yöresel giysiler dikmeye başlamış. Aldığı kredi ile kumaş işleme ipi alarak işleyerek ve üreterek para kazanmak işlerini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy embroidery threads.

loans.name: Misael Alberto

texts.es: Misael de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica a la venta de especies desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando las puertas pero como no tiene de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de puertas y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en:
Misael is 33 years old and lives in his own home with his mother. He earns a living selling spices for various years now and with the revenue from the sales he is able to cover some of the household expenses.

He wants to improve his house by changing the doors, but since he does not have enough capital, he is requesting a loan. The loan is to purchase doors and to pay manual labor, this will allow him to have a more secure home.

loans.use: to purchase doors and pay manual labor.

loans.name: Duhaga Girls School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Moses. He is the Head Teacher of Duhaga Girls School, a girls school with 350 students in the rural area of Hoima. Duhaga Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Duhaga Girls School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Moses ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband, and is the mother of two school aged children. She doesn't work; she is only focusing on her family, and her husband is the main source of income for the family.

Due to a hard financial situation, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her children’s study fees. Her purpose is to ensure that her children achieve high educational levels to be competitive with others.

loans.use: to pay her children’s study fees

loans.name: Rajaa

texts.en:
Rajaa is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman and the mother of one child still attending school. Her husband represents the main income source in the family to satisfy the requirements of life.

Despite a bad financial situation, she is requesting today a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him with the new school year which makes her very optimistic

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees

loans.name: Maicol Nelson

texts.es: EL sr Maicol tiene 32 años estudio una carrera técnica es contador a nivel técnico superior vive juntamente con su esposa que también es contadora tienen una hija pequeña desean abrir su propio negocio un "estudio contable" y requieren el préstamo para equiparlo según los vecinos dicen que es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora desde muy joven fue independiente tuvo que pagarse los estudios solo por no contar con el apoyo de sus padres afirma que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a podido mantenerse en su puesto de trabajo y todo lo que ha logrado hasta ahora ha sido por su propio esfuerzo ya tiene su terreno lo que le falta es trabajar para poder construirse su vivienda hoy requiere del préstamo para  abrir su propia oficina y así generar mejores ingresos los cuales le ayuden a cumplir todos sus objetivos el préstamo invertirá en un equipo de computación muebles de escritorio todo lo necesario para poder empezar a trabajar de manera independiente.
texts.en:
Maicol is 32 years old. He graduated from a technical school, as an accountant. He lives with his wife, who is also an accountant, and their small daughter.

They want to open an accountant's office and need a loan to equip it. His neighbors say that he is a hardworking and enterprising person. He has had to pay his studies since he was very young, because his parents did not support him. He says that thanks to his hard work and persistence, he has been able to keep his job, and that everything he has achieved, is a result of his own effort.

He owns a piece of land. What he needs now is to work to be able to build his house. He needs this loan to open his office and generate more income in order to achieve all his goals.

He will use the loan to buy a computer, furniture, and everything he needs to start working independently.

loans.use: to equip his office, and be able to better serve his clients and generate an income for his family.

loans.name: Sidika

texts.en:
Sıdıka is married and a mother of two. She is breeding chickens and hens in her garden. She sells them to her neighbours. They are very much appreciated, because the breeds are natural, so she has increased the number of her chickens and her sales. With the help of the loan she is planning to buy bait, breed more and expand her business.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff:
Sıdıka hanım evli iki çocuk annesi. Sıdıka hanım bahçesinde tavuk ve civciv yetiştiriyor. Yetiştirdiği tavuk ve civcivleri önce yakınlarına satmış, doğal ürünler olduğu için beğenilmiş ve siparişle satışlarını artırmaya başlamış. Aldığı mikro kredi ile tavuk ve civciv yemi alarak civciv ve tavuk üretmeyi ve işini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Dilek

texts.en:
Dilek is 35 years old, married, and a mother of two. In order to make a contribution to the family budget, she makes handmade products and sells them. As well, she sells cleaning products. She is making sales on the internet. With the help of the loan from Maya, she is planning to buy bulk quantities of cleaning products.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Dilek hanım 35 yaşında evli ve 2 çocuk annesi. Ev ekonomisine katkı sağlamak amacıyla 10 senedir evde el işi ürünler ve temizlik ürünleri satışı yapıyor. Ürünlerinin satışını internet üzerinden yapıyor. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan temizlik ürünleri alacak.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kübra is 24 years old. She works from home, making home decor products from encaustic tiles, and in this way she contributes to the family budget. She was trained in this skill at school. She designs her products and sells them both to her neighbours and to customers she finds on the internet. With the help of the loan from Maya, she is planning to buy bulk quantities of little ceramic products and ceramic paints.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Kübra Hanım 24 yaşında, evde çini işinden ev dekorasyon ürünleri yaparak ek gelir sağlıyor. Okulda bunun eğitimini alan Kübra Hanım yaptığı ürünleri hem çevresine hem de internet üzerinden oluşturduğu müşteri çevresine satıyor. Çini modellerini kendi tasarlıyor. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile küçük seramik ürünler ve çini boyası alacak.

loans.use: to buy little ceramic products and ceramic paints.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 44-year-old married father of two. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees.

The loan is part of Al Majmoua's Back-to-School program, designed to finance school expenses such as books, stationery, transportation, and fees for students from low income families. Funds can be used for partial or complete payment of school expenses.

By supporting this loan, you're enabling access to education for students with limited options. Ibrahim hopes to continue supporting his children's education and improve their living.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Sara 1 Group

texts.en:
Monaya is the featured borrower of Sara 1 group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been close friends, and they seek to develop their living conditions.

Monaya is a 25-year-old single university student who has been working in the tutoring business for five years to cover her living needs and educational expenses.

She is the first lady at the far right side of the picture. Her acquired loan will be invested in paying for her teaching diploma (university degree) expenses.

As for the other group members, Sara is at the left while Zeinab is the lady at the center.

loans.use: to pay for her teaching diploma (university degree) expenses.

loans.name: Adelia Mary

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Adelia, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos,  dos mayores de edad y la menor tiene 15 años y  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Adelia es muy trabajadora y comprende que necesita obtener sus propios recursos para ayudarle a su marido a  sacar adelante su hogar, es por eso  se dedica a la cría de  chanchos y  gallinas criollas, así ella logra ganar sus recursos cuando vende sus animalitos que le son de mucha ayuda ya que son muchos los gastos que hay en su hogar por los estudios de su hija y a su marido se le hace muy difícil solventar estos gastos, gracias a lo que ella hace salen adelante y está muy contenta con los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar maíz, balanceado y otros alimentos para los chanchos y las gallinas. Lleva más de 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Bajos de Montecristi is known for the great variety of traditional products that are sold there, such as the toquilla-straw hats, famous locally, and abroad. The members of the "Mujeres por el Progreso" communal bank meet there every fifteen days.

Adelia lives in this place. She is 49 years old and married. She has three children; two are adults, and the youngest one is a 15-year-old girl who goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Adelia works hard and is aware that she needs to generate her own income to help her husband and get ahead with their family. This is why she raises pigs and a local race of hens. She earns an income by selling her animals, which helps her a lot because there are a lot of expenses at home due to her daughter's studies. It is therefore difficult for her husband to cover this expenses. They are getting ahead thanks to her job. Being able to apply for a loan makes her feel happy.

With this loan, she will buy corn, animal feed, and other types of feed for pigs and hens. She has been a member of this group for more than six years, and she likes to be one because loans help her to get ahead. Her dream is to see her daughter graduate.

loans.use: to buy corn, animal feed, and other types of feed for pigs and hens.

loans.name: Monique Patricia

texts.fr:
Monique est une femme exemple de courage. Elle est veuve et mère de deux enfants de 16 et 14 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés dans des écoles privées. L'éducation des enfants est la chose la plus importante pour elle, c'est sa priorité et la raison de son travail acharné.
Elle dirige un magasin général il y a maintenant 11 ans, L'objectif est de toujours développer et étendre autant que possible le commerce afin d'améliorer le revenu. Le prêt va lui permettre donc de renforcer le fonds de roulement: diversifier et ravitailler les stocks de marchandises.
texts.en:
Monique is a woman of courage. She is a widow and mother of two children of 16 and 14 years old. They are enrolled in private schools. Educating the children is the most important thing for her, it is her priority and the reason for her hard work.

She has been running a general store for 11 years now. The goal is always to develop and expand trade as much as possible to increase income. The loan will thus enable her to strengthen the working capital: diversify and supply stocks of goods.

loans.use: to buy some school supplies: notebooks, pens, portfolios, necessity products: rice, oil, sugar, flour, candles etc.

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad is a 31-year-old married father with three children. He has been selling clothes for nine years, since he gained his experience from his father who taught him how to manage his own business and he was provided with the necessary experience.

Eyad is a Palestinian refugee who was born and lives and works in a refugees camp in Lebanon. Working in a camp is a big challenge, since any business is limited by the same number of customers. So he has to be catch chances to be the first to win the best income business to increase his income and develop his living.

For this reason, Eyad decided to quit the clothes selling business, and he started a new highly requested business in his region, a cable internet service-providing network, in which he is managing providing internet services to camp residences.

Through Eyad's previously acquired loans from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, he established an additional business which targets different types of customers. He opened an Internet cafe, and it is going on just fine.

Today, Eyad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, which he will use to purchase necessary routers and cable network development needs to increase his coverage zone.

This will attract more customers and develop his business. Eyad hopes that he'll stay capable of expanding his businesses, increasing his income, and developing his family's socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To purchase necessary routers and cable network development needs to increase his coverage zone

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en:
Afaf is a 40 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and five children; some of them are still attending school.

Her husband is the main income source in the family in order to enhance their way of living. He works in the construction field, and to supplement the family income, she works from home in producing homemade food.

Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to take a loan from Kiva partner vitas s.a.l to complete the school fees for the new year.

loans.use: to complete the school fees for the new year.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.en:
Khayriniso was born in the year 1976. She is married and is a caring mother of three children. Khayriniso is a very hardworking woman and works hard every day to earn a living.

She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years. She has a lot of experience in this field, and she knows all aspects of her job well.

Khayriniso mainly feeds sheep. She buys sheep from a local market and feeds them for 4-5 months. Khayriniso then sells the sheep, and from the profit she buys food and clothes for her children. She is also going to increase her number of cattle.

She is asking for a loan of 7,900 Somoni (TJS) to buy sheep. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy sheep for increasing working family.

loans.name: Aura Isabel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo de Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Aura, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 20, 14 y 5 años de edad, todos estudian en  universidad, colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa en Manta.
Doña Aura es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para así sentirse independiente y con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar, ella hace mas de 6 años  y con la ayuda de los créditos empezó  a preparar alimentos los mismos que vende en un local que es de sus padres y que por la ubicación sus ventas siempre son buenas, ella trabaja de viernes a domingo y prepara deliciosas meriendas y comidas rápidas, ella también en sus ratos y días que no abre este local vende ropa por catalogo lo cual le deja muy buenos ingresos que son de mucha ayuda ahora que las cosas cada vez son más difíciles.  
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y ropa ya que tiene varios pedidos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del grupo.  Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Los Bajos de Montecristi is a city that is known for its diversity in traditional products, such as straw hats that are sold inside and out of the country. The members of the Mujeres Por El Progreso credit group meet here every 15 days. 

This is also where Aura lives. She is 38 years old, married and has three children ages 20, 14 and 5. They all are in school. Her husband works at a company in the city of Manta. 

Aura is very hardworking and likes to feel independent. With her income, she helps her husband cover the household expenses. With the help of loans, she started preparing food six years ago. She sells her products at a property that belongs to her parents. Since it is in a good location, her sales are always good. She works from Friday to Sunday and prepares delicious snacks and fast food. The rest of the week, she also sells catalog clothing, which also gives her a good income. This is very helpful as things are increasingly difficult. 

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish and clothes. She belongs to the credit group from the beginning and likes it because of the help she receives. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish and clothes.

loans.name: Edilma Esther

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Edilma, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno mayor de edad y otra de 14 años que estudia en  colegio y es la que aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Edilma  es una muy buena mujer que le gusta salir adelante gracias a su labor,  tiene a cargo el bar de una escuela de la localidad, ella muy de mañana se levanta a preparar bocadillos como: empanadas, corviches, entre otros alimentos, así como jugos naturales, para luego llevar al bar de la escuela y venderles a los alumnos que asisten a este centro de estudios, ella también prepara almuerzos los mismos que les vende a los profesores que por su trabajo tiene  que almorzar dentro del plantel, ella siempre varia el menú para que sus niños estén contentos con lo que consumen. Lleva 5 años con su negocio y le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar aceite, plátano, maní y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos.  Lleva 5años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que les da la institución con los créditos. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the Mujeres por el Progreso [Women for Progress] credit group meet in Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for a wide variety of traditional products such as straw hats known within and outside the country.

Edilma lives in this area.  She is 41 years old and married.  From this marriage she has two children: one adult and one who is 14 years old.  The 14-year-old is a student in school and lives in Edilma’s house.  Her husband is a taxi driver.

Edilma is a very good woman who likes to get ahead thanks to her work.  She is in charge of the snack bar in a school in her town.  Early in the morning she gets up to prepare snacks such as empanadas, corviches [croquettes made with plantains and fish], and other foods as well as fresh juices to carry to the school snack bar.  She sells them to the students who attend that school.  She also prepares meals which she sells to the teachers who, due to their work, have to eat on campus.  She always varies the menu so that the children are happy with what they eat.  She has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her.  

She is going to use this loan to buy oil, plantains, peanuts, and other grocery items for preparing food.  She has been in this credit group for five years, and she likes it because of the help that the institution gives her with the loans.  Her dream is to give her daughter the best.

loans.use: to buy oil, plantains, peanuts, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Haruna is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Haruna would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Haruna will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Haruna now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina has owned a clothes shop in the heart of Beirut for more than 15 years. She is 47 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in the family home. Her husband is a private sector employee and one of her sons is in the Lebanese army, while the other goes to university.
When Lina opened her shop 15 years ago, she was seeking to become financially independent from her husband, which allowed him to provide for the family more easily. As her business became successful, Lina also became able to support her husband in the family expenses.
Lina mainly sells women's clothes of good quality in her shop and has earned the loyalty of her clients over the years.

She is asking for a 2,056,987 Lebanese pounds (LEP) loan for the first time from Kiva partner, Ibdaa. With this loan, she is planning on buying a new winter collection to sell in her shop. She is expecting to see her sales grow with this new collection which will also increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new winter collection for her shop.

loans.name: Rashila

texts.en:
Rashila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Rashila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Rashila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Rashila can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Rashila will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Rashila is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education..

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Olamby

texts.en:
Olamby was born in 1963. She is married and has one child. Olamby’s husband is a pensioner. She works in a state organization. Olamby is very hardworking woman and she does her job well.

Her salary is small and she does not have the opportunity to treat her daughter who has been ill for the past year. Olamby is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy medicines for treatment of her daughter. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of her daughter.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 19 year old, married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and does her best to support him with income from her hairdressing occupation, which is barely sufficient. Her business is established at her house, and she welcomes her customers in a very pleasant way. Currently, with the aim of acquiring new beauty tools and supplies, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l.
