Oyimniso is a young woman who lives in a rural area.  She is 32, married, and the mother of one child.  Her husband works the land and also operates a tractor, depending on the season.  Her son helps around the farm and with the livestock.  Oyimniso became involved in animal husbandry after she got married so that she could help her husband provide for the family.  Her husband supported her in her endeavor and helped her to buy a couple head of young livestock.  Gradually, Oyimniso was able to increase her livestock headcount and she started making a good income from animal sales.

Thanks to her farming business, Oyimniso and her family do not lack anything.  At the moment though, because of lower livestock prices, Oyimniso cannot sell her grown livestock without losing a part of her profits.  In order to solve this problem, she has decided to turn to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and she has requested financial support.  She is planning to use her loan to buy some animal feed for the winter and to take advantage of low prices to buy some young livestock.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and young livestock.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en: Mzia is 39 years old. She lives in the small village of Metekhi with her husband. Her husband serves locals as a taxi driver and gets a small income. Mzia wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4,000 GEL. With the received credit, she will begin to trade used clothes and will be able to generate income. Mzia is very motivated and hopes that this business will be profitable for her family.

loans.use: to begin to trade used clothes and generate income.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48-year-old poultry farmer and a single mother in Kilifi, Kenya. For the last two years she has been in this business, earning a great income.

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase day-old chicks, their feeds and medication. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan and educate her children. She hopes to have a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase day-old chicks, their feeds and medication.

loans.name: Lwambi

texts.en:
Lwambi is 38 years old and a farmer at Mariakani Kenya. For the last 20 years he has supplied the residence of Mariakani with green maize and green vegetables with the support of his spouse. Together they are blessed with two children and their business is doing great.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to to purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for replanting. He will use the anticipated profit to lease more land for growing maize. He hopes to harvest more maize on his farm and have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and maize seeds for replanting.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 23 years old. She is married with two children.

She has had a charcoal-sales business for four years. She will be using the loan to purchase to buy more firewood so as to burn more charcoal.

She will be using her anticipated profit to educate her children and also to repay her loan.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a successful life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood so as to burn more charcoal

loans.name: D.f

D. F. is a maize farmer from Sarki village. As a Babban Gona member, D. F. is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Hawwaú

texts.en:
Hawwaú is a maize farmer from G.R.A village. As a Babban Gona member, Hawwaú is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Hawwaú hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jaqueline Yesenia

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Jacqueline, tiene 36  años de edad, está separada y de esa relación  tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 11 años que estudian en escuela y colegio. 
Doña Jaqueline es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para no depender de nadie y darles lo necesario a sus hijos, para esto ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días  a vender y cobrar sus productos ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada semana,  también vende  en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando desean algún producto de los que ella vende, lleva más de 11 años con esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo y darle una buena educación y crianza a sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sabanas y edredones. Lleva más de 3 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
In the low-country of Montecristi, a city known for its great diversity of traditional products, such as straw hats and famous shawls, the members of Banco Comunal Mujeres Por El Progreso meet every 15 days.

In this place lives señora Jacqueline. She is 36 years old, separated from her partner, and from this relationship she has 2 children who are 14 and 11 years old and study at school.

Doña Jaqueline is a woman who likes to be productive for herself and earn her own income as to not depend on anyone and give her children what they need. To this end, she has a business selling clothing of all types, sheets and comforters. Her form of business is door-to-door; she leaves almost every day to sell her products and collect payments since she allows for payment on credit and collects every week. She also sells from her house, where her customers come when they want one of her products. She has had this occupation for over 11 years, which has allowed her to earn her own keep and provide a good education and upbringing to her children.

This loan is to buy clothing, sheets and comforters. She has more than 3 years in the communal bank and she is grateful for the help offered by the loans. Her dream is that her children never lack for anything.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sheets and comforters.

loans.name: Pankarasio

texts.en:
Pankarasio is a 50-year-old hardworking married entrepreneur living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a boutique where he mainly sells clothes like shirts and trousers. He has been in this business for over 20 years. He also supplements his income by practicing agriculture because he got his start-up capital from coffee harvests. Therefore, agriculture is the backbone of his business and life. Educating his children is his biggest treasure though he also intends to begin growing some tea plants as he expands in his agriculture activities.

Pankarasio has faced challenges of few customers and unfavorable seasons but in the preparation of the Christmas season, he requests a loan to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Hawwaú

texts.en:
Hawwaú is a maize farmer from G.R.A village. As a Babban Gona member, Hawwaú is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Hawwaú would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Hawwaú can store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when she can obtain the best price for her maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hawwaú no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Hawwaú hopes to realize better yields. She plans on using her additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 47-year-old hardworking married man with six children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. All of his children attend school and he is very proud of them. His deals in farming as a main source of income, though he also buys and sells dry maize and coffee to help him earn an extra income. He believes he will be able to earn more income and profits, build a permanent house and educate all of his children to a minimum qualification of a degree. However, his main challenges are inadequate capital and manpower to work on the farm.

He is requesting for a loan to pay labor for weeding and harvesting his coffee.

loans.use: to pay labor for weeding and harvesting his coffee.

loans.name: Dahiru

texts.en:
Dahiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dahiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dahiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dahiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dahiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Dahiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family. He looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

Mohammed is a maize farmer from G.R.A village. As a Babban Gona member, Mohammed is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mohammed would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Mohammed can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Mohammed no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Mohammed hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ummaru

texts.en:
Ummaru is a maize farmer from Furana village. As a Babban Gona member, Ummaru is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ummaru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Ummaru can store the maize he harvests and delay selling it until a period later on in the season, when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Ummaru no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Ummaru hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 44 years old and married with four children.

Dinah works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Dinah has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Dinah aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Shohsanam

texts.ru: Шохсанам ,женщина в возрасте 24 года, замужем , имеет 1 ребенка. Она занимается животноводством, а её муж работает строителем в селе. Вместе с мужем они живут очень счастливо. Она  старается помочь мужу, поддерживает его и за это муж благодарен ей. Их семья самая примерная семья в селе, потому что в этой семье уже несколько лет царствует любовь и уважение. Зарплату, которую получает муж им хватает только на проживание. Сейчас они  посоветовавшись вместе, решили купить ещё скот чтобы расширить количество стада, к сожалению таких денег у них нету. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд за кредитом, она заранее благодарна Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Shohsanam is 24 years old, married, and the mother of one child.  She is involved in animal husbandry while her husband works in construction in their own village.  Shohsanam and her husband are very happy together.  Shohsanam does everything she can to help and support her husband and he is, in turn, very grateful for his wife's help.  Their family is cited as an example in the village, because they have been showing love and respect for each other for several years.  However, the salary that Shohsanam's husband makes is only sufficient to cover the very basic necessities of life.  Shohsanam and her husband have therefore decided to buy additional livestock and increase the size of their herd. Unfortunately, they do not have enough money for this type of purchase.  For this reason, Shohsanam has turned to Kiva's partner, MDO Arvand, and she has requested a loan.  She thanks Arvand in advance for their support!

loans.use: to buy additional livestock.

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
Lot, 39, is a married father of four (three girls and one boy) who all go to school. His wife is unemployed, making him the sole breadwinner. He is an experienced welder who has grown his business steadily over the years. He currently has three employees and is looking to expand further by buying new equipment. "A lot of the machines are old, so we need to buy new ones to increase our speed," he explains.

With the loan, he will buy a bending machine, a press drill, an impact drill, and a small welding machine so that he can provide quality products efficiently and on time.

With this loan, Lot wants to create permanent employment for members of his community and provide better standards of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy a pipe bending machine, press drill, impact drill and small welding machine.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Murtala is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Murtala would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Murtala will store the maize he harvests and delay its barter until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Murtala now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as perfumes, bags, underwear and more.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris vive en la comunidad de Copan Honduras, tiene 40 años y es una mujer que ha sabido enfrentarse a la vida para darle lo mejor a su familia. Ella ha criado sola a sus ocho hijos ya que su esposo  falleció hace algún tiempo y ella quedo con una familia muy numerosa, por lo cual ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para llevar el sustento a su casa. Desde hace 22 años se dedica a la ganadería, y a la cría de cerdos, actividad en la cual le ayudan  sus hijos mayores. Como toda buena madre ella desea lo mejor para sus hijos y que ellos tengan una buena educación y las mejores condiciones de vida posibles; pero debido a que en la comunidad donde viven no cuentan con servicio de energía eléctrica Doris solicita a Soluz Honduras un préstamo para adquirir un Sistema solar que le beneficiaria a su familia en las tareas diarias, como levantarse más temprano para el ordeño de las vacas, tener una mejor iluminación en toda la vivienda y que sus hijos que están en la escuela puedan realizar sin dificultas  sus labores escolares por las noches.
texts.en:
Doris, age 40, lives in the community of Copan, Honduras, and is a woman who has learned to deal with life in order to give the best to her family. She has raised her eight children on her own, as her husband passed away some time ago, and she was left with a very large family. That is why she has had to do her very best in order to support her household.


She has been raising cattle and pigs for 22 years.Her older children help her with this work. Like every good mother, she wants the best for her children and for them to have a good education and the best living conditions possible. But due to the fact that in the community where they live does not have electricity, Doris is applying to Solus Honduras for a loan to buy to buy a solar energy system that will benefit her family in their daily tasks such as getting up early to milk the cows, provide better lighting in the entire house, and ensure that her children who are in school can do their schoolwork in the evenings without difficulty.

loans.use: to purchase a solar power system for lighting, which will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. His father represents the main source of income for the family. Rami works as a farmer in order to earn extra money and be able to live a respectful life. Today, he is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his nephew’s school fees. He is very thankful to Kiva because it will permit him to help his nephew to achieve his educational levels.

loans.use: to pay his nephew’s school fees

loans.name: Atipay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ATIPAY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sara Rossana, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de pinturas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora la cual espera obtener mediantes su negocio mas ganancias para de esta forma continuar apoyando a su familia, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pinturas de varios colores.
  Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Atipay." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, part of the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Sara Rossana is a member who is continuing with her business of selling paints. She has been doing this for a while. It is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She is an entrepreneurial woman who hopes to obtain, through her business, more income and in this way, be able to continue supporting her family. This is the way that she is moving her family forward.

Sara Rossana is requesting the loan to buy paints of various colors.

The members in the attached photos asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for health and work reasons.

loans.use: to buy paints of assorted colors

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida hails from the town of Alicia, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities ranging from noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is a married woman and has four children. Her oldest child is 17 while the youngest is 10. Her husband is a farmer.

Her sari-sari (variety} store is situated near her home and serves customers, mostly neighbors and nearby residents.

She would like to improve her main source of income to become more productive and improve the family’s living condition.

Zenaida wants to buy assorted goods like canned goods, soft drinks and condiments. In that way, she would be able to continue to expand her business.

In the future, she is determined to work hard to become more successful and to continue to finance the schooling of all her children.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods  like canned goods, soft drinks and condiments

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 30 year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and her three children, all attending school. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to enhance their way of living.

Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the last installment of their study fees. She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their education.

loans.use: to pay the last installment of her children's study fees.

loans.name: Eliane

texts.en:
Eliane is a 19-year-old, Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents who cooperate together and represent the main source of income. As for her, she is still attending university. She is very tender and cares a lot about all of her family members.

Today, she is eager to borrow a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas. s.a.l., to pay her university educational fees. She said that she is very happy with the loan that will allow her to continue her education suitably.

loans.use: to pay her university educational fees

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 40-year-old married lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a business distilling waragi, a local drink, in her village. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after her children and her family. She has been doing this business since 2013, and working extra hard to make sure she earns a lot of income for her family so they have many assets. The setback that she complains about is the high license fees. Annet has asked for a loan to enable her to buy sorghum to use in preparing waragi, a local drink in her village.

loans.use: to buy sorghum to use in preparing waragi, a local drink, in her village.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en:
Yunusa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yunusa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yunusa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Yunusa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yunusa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD per hectare of land. Yunusa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mesias

texts.es:
Mesias 34 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar de material rústico,junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 1 año tres meses de edad, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura cultivo de café, cría y venta de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea,de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación esta en segundo año de producción, cultivo de café lo realiza en el Caserío de Miraflores distrito de Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza hace ya 5 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, cerdo) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) para su consumo y en ocasiones para la venta y además trabaja como peón agrícola.El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar calidad de vida de él y de su familia.

Mesias es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Mesias is 34 years old. He is in a common-law relationship. He lives in the rustic family home together with his wife and young son who is 1 year and 3 months old. He lives in the district of Santo Tomas, in the province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca in Peru. He has many very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area. The inhabitants of this area principally work in the cultivation of coffee, the raising and selling of small animals and the cultivation of basic food crops.

Mesias works in agriculture, specifically in the cultivation of coffee. At this time, he has 1 hectare of the Catimor variety that is resistant to disease and pests. The farm is in its second year of production in the Caserio de Miraflores district of Santo Tomas. He has been doing this for five years.

In addition, he works raising small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs) and cultivating basic crops (yucca, banana, taro) for eating and sometimes for selling. He also works as an agricultural laborer.

The loan will be used for the maintenance and cultivation of the 1 hectare of coffee in production, assuring good production for the 2016 season. This would be reflected in a larger volume of sales; therefore, he will obtain greater earnings and in this way be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Mesias is a new member for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: maintain and cultivate 1 hectare of coffee

loans.name: Jhenny

texts.es:
Jhenny es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tienen una hija de 1 año, y su negocio es la frutería.
Ella es emprendedora, trabajadora y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Batallas’ ubicada a 62 kilómetros de la ciudad a orillas del lago sagrado ‘Titicaca’, la gente del lugar se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y pesca mayormente.
Jhenny es de piel morena, cabello negro largo trenzado y baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la pesca y con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica, no cuenta con agua ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, como: papayas, plátanos, manzanas, quiwi, sandia, naranjas y otros, “heredé mi negocio de mi familia porque ellos también se dedican a la venta de fruta…” comenta. Actividad que realiza en ferias en comunidades alejadas. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con transporte propio para transportar la mercadería, la desventaja es la falta de capital para comprar más fruta. Su sueño es tener su casa propia, ella desea comprar fruta por mayor para vender al menudeo. Esta es la 1 secuenciad e préstamos con la institución en 6 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jhenny solicita un préstamo para comprar fruta por mayor para vender en comunidades alejadas.
texts.en:
Jhenny is a 35-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and they have a one-year-old daughter. Her business is a fruit stand.

She is enterprising, hardworking, and very tenacious. She carries out her business in the town of 'Batallas,' located 62 kilometers from the city on the shores of the sacred lake 'Titicaca.' The people there work mainly in agriculture, livestock, and fishing.

Jhenny is dark skinned, has long braided black hair, and is of short stature. Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks here, and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for the business she does. She shares her life with her partner who works in fishing, and with her child who isn't school aged yet. They live in a house that belongs to the family, built of adobe, that has electricity. It does not have water or a sewage system.

Her business is fruit sales, such as: papayas, plantains, apples, kiwi, watermelon, oranges, and others. "I inherited my business from my family because they also work in fruit sales..." she says. She carries out her business at festivals in far away communities. The advantage of her business is that she has her own transportation to transport the merchandise. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy more fruit. Her dream is to have her own house. She wants to buy wholesale fruit to sell retail. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in 6 years of carrying out this business.

For these reasons, Jhenny requests a loan to buy wholesale fruit to sell in far away communities.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruit to sell in far away communities.

loans.name: Jose Felix

texts.es:
José Felix con 47 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y su cuatro menores hijos, en el distrito de Pimpingos,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente al cultivo de café,de variedad Catimor, contando a la fecha con 1 hectárea en producción de 4 y 5 años de edad, resistente a enfermedades y plagas, este cultivo realiza en terreno propio.Producto lo vende en Distrito Pimpingos a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente cría animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, menestras, vitucas y otros productos de la zona. El destino del crédito será para asumir gastos de mantenimiento de parcela agrícola de 1 hectárea de 4 y 5 años de edad, en fase de espigas florales, asegurando campaña 2016 con una mejor y mayor producción reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

José Felix es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Firmará sólo.
texts.en:
José Felix is 47 years old. He lives with his spouse and four minor children in the district of Pimpingos, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department in Perú. He has very good personal and work references from the area's residents. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

He works in agriculture, specifically growing Catimore varietal coffee. At this time he has one hectare of land in production that is 4 to 5 years old, resistant to sicknesses and infestations. He grows on his own land and sells his product in the Pimpingos district to local. He also raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and others) and grows food products (yucca, legumes, taro and other products from the area).

The loan will be used to take on the expense of maintaining a one hectare plot of land that is 4 to 5 years old and is flowering. This assures the 2016 season to be better with higher production reflected in a greater volume of sales and in the end greater income so he can improve his quality of living and that of his family.

José Felix is a repeat member of Edpyme Alternativa. He is signing by himself.

loans.use: to take on the expense of maintaining a one hectare plot of land that is 4 to 5 years old.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a maize farmer from Kampa-Murga village. As a Babban Gona member, Saidu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saidu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Saidu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saidu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Saidu hopes to realize better yields. He plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yudith Maritza

texts.es:
Yudith, de 35 años de edad, estudio octavo grado, está casada y su esposo trabaja como motorista, tiene 2 hijos que están en la escuela.

Yudith, desde hace 12 años de edad se dedica al comercio de ropa y de calzado; ella decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque quería ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, junto a su esposo tenían un pequeño ahorro de $500 y con ese dinero decidieron iniciar con ese negocio y poco a poco creció, pero hace un año les robaron todo y hoy está comenzando de nuevo y ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. porque hay que preparar a sus hijos para la escuela, pues su negocio se encuentra a 1 kilómetro de su casa y ella abre el negocio a las 7:00 a.m. y cierran a las 5:00 p.m.

Yudith, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa, porque se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y en esa época se vende un poco más.

Su sueño es, ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria y surtir su negocio más surtido y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yudith, who is 35 years old, went to school through eighth grade. She is married and her husband works as a driver. She has two children, who are in school.

For 12 years Yudith has worked in the clothing and footwear business. She decided to work in this business because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She and her husband had a little savings of $500, and with this money they decided to set up this business, and little by little it grew. But a year ago they were robbed of everything, and now she is beginning again. She gets up every day at 4:30 a.m. because she has to prepare her children for school and since her business is a kilometer from her house. She opens the business at 7:00 a.m., and they close at 5:00 p.m.

Yudith needs the loan to buy clothing, because the end-of-year holidays are approaching and in this season she sells a little more.

Her dreams are to see her children graduate from a university program, to have her business better stocked, and to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Gloria Esmeraldas

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos,  tres mayores de edad y la menor de 17 años que   estudia en colegio y es la única que vive con ellos. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Gloria es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma para salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí solo vende víveres primarios, ella también vende  ropa de todo tipo ya sean en su tienda o  puerta a puerta, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días.  Gracias a los créditos ella cada vez mejora su negocio el cual le deja muy buenos ingresos que le permiten salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir su tienda y  ropa de todo tipo. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos mejora su vida razón por lo cual está muy agradecida con la fundación y con los que le ayudan con los créditos. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
In the Los Bajos neighborhood of Montecristi, a city known for its wide variety of traditional products such as hand-woven straw hats which are famous domestically and internationally, the members of the "Mujeres Por EL Progreso" communal bank meet every fifteen days.

Gloria lives here. She is 59 years old, married and from this relationship has four children. Three of them are adults and the youngest, 17 years old, attends school and is the only one still living with them. Her husband is a chauffeur.

Gloria is a woman who likes to rely on herself to get ahead. She has a small food store in her home, where she sells basic foods. She also sells all kinds of clothing in her store and door to door. She offers her customers credit and collects every fifteen days. Thanks to the loans she is improving her business, which provides her very good income and allows her to get ahead.

This loan is to buy food to stock her store and all kinds of clothing. She has been in the communal bank since the beginning. She likes it as thanks to the loans she is improving her life. For that reason she is very grateful to the foundation and to those who help fund the loans. Her dream is that her daughter will be a professional one day.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest in order to meet his immediate cash needs for such things as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ayuba will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price at a premium up to 37% more than at harvest.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, Ayuba now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of growing his agriculture business for himself and family members, and he would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community on his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Ana Elida

texts.es:
Ana, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos, pero todos están casados.

Ana, junto a su esposo tiene 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura y la ganadería, pues ellos siembran maíz, maicillo y pipian; pero últimamente solo siembran maicillo para alimento del ganado, sus cultivos están a 2 ½ kilómetros, de su casa.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar una vaca lechera, para elaborar productos lácteos y generar nuevos ingresos.

Sus sueños son poder comprar más terreno para pastar su ganado y también quiere comprar un carro para halar la comida para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Ana, 49, went to school until the second grade. She is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has four children, but they are all married.

Ana and her husband have been working in agriculture and ranching for 30 years. They grow corn, sorghum, and squash. Recently they have only planted sorghum to feed their livestock. Their crops are located 2.5 kilometers from their home.

Ana needs this loan to buy a dairy cow, in order to make dairy products and generate new income.

Her dreams are to be able to buy more land for her livestock to graze and also to buy a car to transport the feed for her cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Naómi

texts.en:
Naómi is a maize farmer from Gayya village. As a Babban Gona member, she is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give her the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Naómi would have had to sell her maize at harvest, when the price is at its lowest, to meet her immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Naómi can now store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until later in the season when she can obtain the best price at a premium of up to 37% higher.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Naómi no longer feels the pressure to sell her maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare, she hopes to realize better yields and plans on using her additional income to ensure that all her children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Nelly Diluvina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 64 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda pero de esta relación tiene 10 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella.
Doña Nelly es una mujer muy luchadora que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y así salir adelante, ella tiene una  papelería en una casa que tiene en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja con la ayuda de sus hijos todos los días. En el campo lugar en el cual ella vive también tiene una granja en la se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, este negocio de cría de animales recién lo empezó hace poco ya que siempre utilizo los créditos para su papelería, pero ella siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos por eso con los créditos compro estos animalitos que le están dejando muy buenos ingresos. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimento para pollos y chanchos y útiles escorares para su papelería. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su vida.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of traditional products such as, for example, the Panama hats known within and outside the country, the members of the loan group "Mujeres por el Progreso" (Women for Progress) meet every two weeks.

Señora Nelly lives in this place. She is 64 years old. Her husband died a number of years ago, and she was left a widow, but from this relation she has 10 adult children. One of them still lives with her.

Doña Nelly is a very hard-working woman who has always liked to work and thus get ahead. She has a stationery store in a house that she has in the center of the city. There she works every day with the help of her children. In the countryside, the place where she lives, she also has a farm where she raises chickens and pigs. She began this business of raising animals recently, since she has always used to loans for her stationery store, but she has always looked for a way to improve her income. For this reason, she bought these little animals, which are giving her very good income, with the loans.

She is going to use this loan to buy food for the chickens and pigs, as well as school supplies for her stationery store. She is a founding member of the loan group, and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to continue improving her life.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and pigs, as well as school supplies.

loans.name: Hilda Aura

texts.es: Hilda tiene 59 años de edad, vive en unión libre su esposo trabaja como chofer lejos de su hogar, empezó desde los 19 años a vender ropa y zapatos por las calles hoy lo hace mediante catalogo o revistas aspira ubicarse en un pequeño local para vender su mercadería ya que en las calles asume mucho riesgo de que le roben todo su capital de trabajo. Hilda con el dinero comprara un mostrador de ropa y zapatos, incrementara  mercadería  obteniendo ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos básicos  del hogar a futuro desea tener una pequeña casa propia.
texts.en:
Hilda, 59, lives with a domestic partner. Her husband works as a driver far from home. She began selling clothing and shoes as a street vendor when she was 19 years old. Today she sells through catalogs or magazines. Her goal is to set up a small shop to sell her merchandise, because on the street there is a great risk of having all of her capital stolen.

With this money, Hilda will buy a display case for clothing and shoes and expand her inventory to obtain income to help her husband with the basic household expenses. In the future, she wants to have a small house of her own.

loans.use: to buy a display case for clothing and shoes, and to increase her inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Iliya Lado

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when maize prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support he can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from their marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Slavik

texts.en:
Slavik is 46 years old and he lives in the city of Sevan in the Gegharkunik region. He works at the bread factory as a driver-distributor, and his wife works as a baker in the same factory. They have 2 children. Their daughter is already married while their son is still school-aged.

Slavik and his wife spend their income very carefully in order to be able to pay for the repairs for their house, which has not been repaired for nearly 20 years. In the summer, they started the work and, since Slavik is a Jack of all trades, he did everything himself without any contractors.

Now, some work remains left half-done because their savings are spent and they lack the necessary funds. The 700,000 AMD loan he requests will finally complete their house repairs, making their home nice and more comfortable.

loans.use: to finish his home repairs.
